entry.description: Trigger delay time in ms from the time defined by value of Respiratory Trigger Delay Threshold (0020,9256) following the previous maximum value of respiration, to the value of the Frame Reference Datetime (0018,9151). See C.7.6.16.2.17.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Irradiation Event Identification Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the Irradiation Event Identification for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Irradiation Event UID
entry.description: Unique identification of the irradiation event(s) associated with the acquisition of this image.

entry.name: Dimension Organization Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that lists the Dimension Organization UIDs referenced by the containing SOP Instance. See section C.7.6.17.2 for further explanation. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Dimension Organization UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a set of dimensions referenced within the containing SOP Instance. See section C.7.6.17.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Dimension Description Label
entry.description: Free text description that explains the meaning of the dimension.

entry.name: Dimension Index Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the sequence containing the indices used to specify the dimension of the multi-frame object. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Dimension Index Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag that is used to identify the Attribute connected with the index. See section C.7.6.17.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Dimension Index Private Creator
entry.description: Identification of the creator of a group of private data elements. Required if the Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

entry.name: >Functional Group Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the Functional Group Sequence that contains the Attribute that is referenced by the Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165). See section C.7.6.17.1 for further explanation. Required if the value of the Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165) is the Data Element Tag of an Attribute that is contained within a Functional Group Sequence.

entry.name: >Functional Group Private Creator
entry.description: Identification of the creator of a group of private data elements. Required if the Functional Group Pointer 0020,9167) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

entry.name: >Dimension Organization UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a set of dimensions referenced within the containing SOP Instance. In particular the dimension described by this sequence item is associated with this Dimension Organization UID. See section C.7.6.17.2 for further explanation. Required if the value of the Dimension Index Sequence (0020,9222) contains Items

entry.name: Cardiac Synchronization Technique
entry.description: Defines if a cardiac synchronization technique was applied during or after the acquisition. Enumerated Values: NONE REALTIME = total time for the acquisition is shorter than cardiac cycle, no gating is applied PROSPECTIVE = certain thresholds have been set for a gating window that defines the acceptance of measurement data during the acquisition RETROSPECTIVE = certain thresholds have been set for a gating window that defines the acceptance of measurement data after the acquisition PACED = there is a constant RR interval (e.g., Pacemaker), which makes thresholding not required Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Cardiac Signal Source
entry.description: Cardiac Signal Source. Defined Terms: ECG = electrocardiogram VCG = vector cardiogram PP = peripheral pulse MR = magnetic resonance, i.e. M-mode or cardiac navigator Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

entry.name: Cardiac RR Interval Specified
entry.description: R-R interval in ms measured prior to or during the scan. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

entry.name: Cardiac Beat Rejection Technique
entry.description: Cardiac arrhythmia rejection technique. Defined Terms: NONE RR_INTERVAL = rejection based on deviation from average RR interval QRS_LOOP = rejection based on deviation from regular QRS loop PVC = rejection based on PVC criteria Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.

entry.name: Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in ms. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.

entry.name: High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in ms. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.

entry.name: Intervals Acquired
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals acquired. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

entry.name: Intervals Rejected
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals rejected. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

entry.name: Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique
entry.description: Applied technique to reduce respiratory motion artifacts. Defined Terms: NONE BREATH_HOLD REALTIME = image acquisition shorter than respiratory cycle GATING = Prospective gating TRACKING = prospective through-plane or in-plane motion tracking PHASE_ORDERING = prospective phase ordering PHASE_RESCANNING = prospective techniques, such as real-time averaging, diminishing variance and motion adaptive gating RETROSPECTIVE = retrospective gating CORRECTION = retrospective image correction Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Respiratory Signal Source
entry.description: Signal source from which respiratory motion is derived. Defined Terms: NONE BELT NASAL_PROBE CO2_SENSOR NAVIGATOR = MR navigator and organ edge detection MR_PHASE = phase (of center k-space line) ECG = baseline demodulation of the ECG Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170) equals other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170 equals other than NONE.

entry.name: Respiratory Trigger Delay Threshold
entry.description: Respiratory trigger threshold in percent of the chest expansion for the frame relative to the last Respiratory-Peak. See C.7.6.16.2.17.1 for further explanation. Required if Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170) equals other than NONE, REALTIME or BREATH_HOLD and if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Bulk Motion Compensation Technique
entry.description: Applied technique to reduce bulk or other physiology motion artifacts. Defined Terms: NONE REALTIME = image acquisition shorter than motion cycle GATING = prospective gating TRACKING = prospective through and/or in‑plane motion tracking RETROSPECTIVE = retrospective gating CORRECTION = retrospective image correction Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Bulk Motion Signal Source
entry.description: Signal source to measure motion. Defined Terms: JOINT = joint motion detection NAVIGATOR = MR navigator and organ edge detection MR_PHASE = phase (of center k‑space line) Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Bulk Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9172) equals other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Bulk Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9172) equals other than NONE.

table.name: SUPPLEMENTAL PALETTE COLOR TABLE LOOKUP MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201). See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1202). See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Blue Palette Color Lookup table Data (0028,1203). See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201). Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1202). Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Blue Palette Color Lookup table Data (0028,1203). Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Palette Color Lookup Table UID
entry.description: Palette Color Lookup Table UID. See C.7.9.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is NOT used in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is NOT used in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is NOT used in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Segmented Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Segmented Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is used in an Image IOD; shall not be present in a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.9.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Segmented Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Segmented Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is used in an Image IOD; shall not be present in a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.9.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Segmented Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Segmented Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is used in an Image IOD; shall not be present in a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.9.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Body Part Examined
entry.description: Text description of the part of the body examined. Defined Terms: SKULL CSPINE TSPINE LSPINE SSPINE COCCYX CHEST CLAVICLE BREAST ABDOMEN PELVIS HIP SHOULDER ELBOW KNEE ANKLE HAND FOOT EXTREMITY HEAD HEART NECK LEG ARM JAW

entry.name: View Position
entry.description: Radiographic view associated with Patient Position (0018,5100). Defined Terms: AP = Anterior/Posterior PA = Posterior/Anterior LL = Left Lateral RL = Right Lateral RLD = Right Lateral Decubitus LLD = Left Lateral Decubitus RLO = Right Lateral Oblique LLO = Left Lateral Oblique

entry.name: Filter Type
entry.description: Label for the type of filter inserted into the x-ray beam

entry.name: Collimator/grid Name
entry.description: Label describing any grid inserted.

entry.name: Focal Spot
entry.description: Size of the focal spot in mm. For devices with variable focal spot or multiple focal spots, small dimension followed by large dimension.

entry.name: Plate Type
entry.description: Label of the type of storage phosphor plates used in this series

entry.name: Phosphor Type
entry.description: Label of type of phosphor on the plates

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. Shall have one of the following Enumerated Values: MONOCHROME1 MONOCHROME2

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the x-ray generator used

entry.name: Plate ID
entry.description: The ID or serial number of the sensing plate upon which the image was acquired

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view) . Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Exposure Time
entry.description: Time of x-ray exposure in msec

entry.name: X-ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-ray Tube Current in mA.

entry.name: Exposure
entry.description: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure in µAs
entry.description: The exposure expressed in µAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Imager Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance measured at the front plane of the Image Receptor housing between the center of each pixel. Specified by a numeric pair - row spacing value (delimiter) column spacing value - in mm. In the case of CR, the front plane is defined to be the external surface of the CR plate closest to the patient and radiation source.

include.ref: Include Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro (Table 10-10)

entry.name: Generator Power
entry.description: Power in kW to the x-ray generator.

entry.name: Acquisition Device Processing Description
entry.description: Describes device-specific processing associated with the image (e.g. Organ Description)

entry.name: Acquisition Device Processing Code
entry.description: Code representing the device-specific processing associated with the image (e.g. CR Organ Filtering code)

entry.name: Cassette Orientation
entry.description: Orientation of cassette, used to properly position the image for display. Enumerated Values: LANDSCAPE PORTRAIT

entry.name: Cassette Size
entry.description: Size of cassette. Defined Terms: 18CMX24CM 8INX10IN 24CMX30CM 10INX12IN 30CMX35CM 30CMX40CM 11INX14IN 35CMX35CM 14INX14IN 35CMX43CM 14INX17IN

entry.name: Exposures on Plate
entry.description: Total number of x-ray exposures that have been made on the plate identified in Plate ID (0018,1004)

entry.name: Relative X-ray Exposure
entry.description: Relative x-ray exposure on the plate. Meaning of values is implementation specific. May be used to adjust the dynamic range of the plate digitizer (scanner).

entry.name: Sensitivity
entry.description: Read out sensitivity.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7 Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4009.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.2.1.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.2.1.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.2.1.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.2.1.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See C.8.2.1.1.5 for specialization.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. See C.8.2.1.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Rescale Intercept
entry.description: The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and Hounsfield (HU). HU = m*SV+b

entry.name: Rescale Slope
entry.description: m in the equation specified in Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the x-ray generator used

entry.name: Acquisition Number
entry.description: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time which resulted in this image

entry.name: Scan Options
entry.description: Parameters of scanning sequence.

entry.name: Data Collection Diameter
entry.description: The diameter in mm of the region over which data were collected

entry.name: Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: Diameter in mm of the region from within which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view). Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Gantry/Detector Tilt
entry.description: Nominal angle of tilt in degrees of the scanning gantry. Not intended for mathematical computations.

entry.name: Table Height
entry.description: The distance in mm of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation; below the center is positive.

entry.name: Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of rotation of the source when relevant, about nearest principal axis of equipment. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter clockwise

entry.name: Exposure Time
entry.description: Time of x-ray exposure in msec

entry.name: X-ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-ray Tube Current in mA.

entry.name: Exposure
entry.description: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure in µAs
entry.description: The exposure expressed in µAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Filter Type
entry.description: Label for the type of filter inserted into the x-ray beam.

entry.name: Generator Power
entry.description: Power in kW to the x-ray generator.

entry.name: Focal Spot
entry.description: Size of the focal spot in mm. For devices with variable focal spot or multiple focal spots, small dimension followed by large dimension.

entry.name: Convolution Kernel
entry.description: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data

entry.name: Revolution Time
entry.description: The time in seconds of a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.

entry.name: Single Collimation Width
entry.description: The width of a single row of acquired data (in mm). Note: Adjacent physical detector rows may have been combined to form a single effective acquisition row.

entry.name: Total Collimation Width
entry.description: The width of the total collimation (in mm) over the area of active x-ray detection. Note: This will be equal the number of effective detector rows multiplied by single collimation width.

entry.name: Table Speed
entry.description: The distance in mm that the table moves in one second during the gathering of data that resulted in this image.

entry.name: Table Feed per Rotation
entry.description: Motion of the table (in mm) during a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.

entry.name: Spiral Pitch Factor
entry.description: Ratio of the Table Feed per Rotation (0018,9310) to the Total Collimation Width (0018,9307).

entry.name: Exposure Modulation Type
entry.description: A label describing the type of exposure modulation used for the purpose of limiting the dose. Defined Terms: NONE

entry.name: Estimated Dose Saving
entry.description: A percent value of dose saving due to the use of Exposure Modulation Type (0018,9323). A negative percent value of dose savings reflects an increase of exposure.

entry.name: CTDIvol
entry.description: Computed Tomography Dose Index (CTDIvol), im mGy according to IEC 60601-2-44, Ed.2.1 (Clause 29.1.103.4), The Volume CTDIvol. It describes the average dose for this image for the selected CT conditions of operation.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7 Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4030.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.3.1.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.3.1.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.3.1.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.3.1.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Scanning Sequence
entry.description: Description of the type of data taken. Enumerated Values: SE = Spin Echo IR = Inversion Recovery GR = Gradient Recalled EP = Echo Planar RM = Research Mode Note: Multi-valued, but not all combinations are valid (e.g. SE/GR, etc.).

entry.name: Sequence Variant
entry.description: Variant of the Scanning Sequence. Defined Terms: SK = segmented k-space MTC = magnetization transfer contrast SS = steady state TRSS = time reversed steady state SP = spoiled MP = MAG prepared OSP = oversampling phase NONE = no sequence variant

entry.name: Scan Options
entry.description: Parameters of scanning sequence. Defined Terms: PER = Phase Encode Reordering RG = Respiratory Gating CG = Cardiac Gating PPG = Peripheral Pulse Gating FC = Flow Compensation PFF = Partial Fourier - Frequency PFP = Partial Fourier - Phase SP = Spatial Presaturation FS = Fat Saturation

entry.name: MR Acquisition Type
entry.description: Identification of data encoding scheme. Enumerated Values: 2D = frequency x phase 3D = frequency x phase x phase

entry.name: Repetition Time
entry.description: The period of time in msec between the beginning of a pulse sequence and the beginning of the succeeding (essentially identical) pulse sequence. Required except when Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) is EP and Sequence Variant (0018,0021) is not SK.

entry.name: Echo Time
entry.description: Time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced (kx=0). In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the middle of the excitation pulse to the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space (i.e.-kx=0, ky=0).

entry.name: Echo Train Length
entry.description: Number of lines in k-space acquired per excitation per image.

entry.name: Inversion Time
entry.description: Time in msec after the middle of inverting RF pulse to middle of excitation pulse to detect the amount of longitudinal magnetization. Required if Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) has values of IR.

entry.name: Trigger Time
entry.description: Time, in msec, between peak of the R wave and the peak of the echo produced. In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space. Required for Scan Options (0018,0022) which include heart gating (e.g. CG, PPG, etc.)

entry.name: Sequence Name
entry.description: User defined name for the Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) and Sequence Variant (0018,0021) combination.

entry.name: Angio Flag
entry.description: Angio Image Indicator. Primary image for Angio processing. Enumerated Values: Y = Image is Angio N = Image is not Angio

entry.name: Number of Averages
entry.description: Number of times a given pulse sequence is repeated before any parameter is changed

entry.name: Imaging Frequency
entry.description: Precession frequency in MHz of the nucleus being addressed

entry.name: Imaged Nucleus
entry.description: Nucleus that is resonant at the imaging frequency. Examples: 31P, 1H

entry.name: Echo Number
entry.description: The echo number used in generating this image. In the case of segmented k-space, it is the effective Echo Number.

entry.name: Magnetic Field Strength
entry.description: Nominal field strength of MR magnet, in Tesla

entry.name: Spacing Between Slices
entry.description: Spacing between slices, in mm. The spacing is measured from the center-to-center of each slice.

entry.name: Number of Phase Encoding Steps
entry.description: Total number of lines in k-space in the 'y' direction collected during acquisition.

entry.name: Percent Sampling
entry.description: Fraction of acquisition matrix lines acquired, expressed as a percent.

entry.name: Percent Phase Field of View
entry.description: Ratio of field of view dimension in phase direction to field of view dimension in frequency direction, expressed as a percent.

entry.name: Pixel Bandwidth
entry.description: Reciprocal of the total sampling period, in hertz per pixel.

entry.name: Nominal Interval
entry.description: Average R-R interval used for the scans, in msec

entry.name: Beat Rejection Flag
entry.description: Beat length sorting has been applied. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = No

entry.name: Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: Intervals Acquired
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals acquired.

entry.name: Intervals Rejected
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals rejected.

entry.name: PVC Rejection
entry.description: Description of type of PVC rejection criteria used.

entry.name: Skip Beats
entry.description: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia.

entry.name: Heart Rate
entry.description: Beats per minute.

entry.name: Cardiac Number of Images
entry.description: Number of images per cardiac cycle.

entry.name: Trigger Window
entry.description: Percent of R-R interval, based on Heart Rate (0018,1088), prescribed as a window for a valid/usable trigger.

entry.name: Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: Diameter in mm. of the region from within which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.

entry.name: Receive Coil Name
entry.description: Receive coil used.

entry.name: Transmit Coil Name
entry.description: Transmit coil used.

entry.name: Acquisition Matrix
entry.description: Dimensions of the acquired frequency /phase data before reconstruction. Multi-valued: frequency rows\frequency columns\phase rows\phase columns.

entry.name: In-plane Phase Encoding Direction
entry.description: The axis of phase encoding with respect to the image. Enumerated Values: ROW = phase encoded in rows. COL = phase encoded in columns.

entry.name: Flip Angle
entry.description: Steady state angle in degrees to which the magnetic vector is flipped from the magnetic vector of the primary field.

entry.name: SAR
entry.description: Calculated whole body Specific Absorption Rate in watts/kilogram.

entry.name: Variable Flip Angle Flag
entry.description: Flip angle variation applied during image acquisition. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no

entry.name: dB/dt
entry.description: The rate of change of the gradient coil magnetic flux density with time (T/s).

entry.name: Temporal Position Identifier
entry.description: Temporal order of a dynamic or functional set of Images.

entry.name: Number of Temporal Positions
entry.description: Total number of temporal positions prescribed.

entry.name: Temporal Resolution
entry.description: Time delta between Images in a dynamic or functional set of Images.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7 Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4030.

entry.name: Patient Orientation Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. See C.8.4.6.1.1 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 19. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of “99SDM” for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: > Patient Orientation Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: Patient Orientation Modifier. Required if needed to fully specify the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. See C.8.4.6.1.2 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 20. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of “99SDM” for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence which describes the orientation of the patient with respect to the gantry. See Section C.8.4.6.1.3 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 21. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of “99SDM” for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (color planes) in this image. The value shall be 1.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.4.7.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. Enumerated Values: 8, 16.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. The value shall be the same as the value in Bits Allocated (0028,0100).

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. Shall be one less than the value in Bits Stored (0028,0101).

entry.name: Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance in the patient between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing, in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order.

entry.name: Frame Increment Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tags of one or more frame index vectors. See C.8.4.8.1.1 for further specialization.

entry.name: Energy Window Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the energy window number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Energy Window Vector (0054,0010). See C.8.4.8.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Energy Windows
entry.description: Number of energy window groupings. See C.8.4.8.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Detector Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the detector number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Detector Vector (0054,0020). See C.8.4.8.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Detectors
entry.description: Number of detectors. See C.8.4.8.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Phase Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the phase number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030). See C.8.4.8.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Phases
entry.description: Number of phases. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030). See C.8.4.8.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Rotation Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the rotation number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Rotation Vector (0054,0050). See C.8.4.8.1.5 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Rotations
entry.description: Number of rotations. Required if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3 is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO, or RECON GATED TOMO. See C.8.4.8.1.5 for specialization.

entry.name: R-R Interval Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the R-R interval number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). See C.8.4.8.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of R-R Intervals
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). See C.8.4.8.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Time Slot Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the time slot number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070). See C.8.4.8.1.7 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Time Slots
entry.description: Number of time slots. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070). See C.8.4.8.1.7 for specialization.

entry.name: Slice Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the spatial slice number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Slice Vector (0054,0080). See C.8.4.8.1.8 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Slices
entry.description: Number of slices. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Slice Vector (0054,0080). See C.8.4.8.1.8 for specialization.

entry.name: Angular View Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the angular view number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Angular View Vector (0054,0090). See C.8.4.8.1.9 for specialization.

entry.name: Time Slice Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the time slice number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Time Slice Vector (0054,0100). See C.8.4.8.1.10 for specialization.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.4.9.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Image ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated Image identifier.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5 Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image.

entry.name: Counts Accumulated
entry.description: Sum of all gamma events for all frames in the image. See C.8.4.9.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Acquisition Termination Condition
entry.description: Description of how the data collection was stopped. Defined Terms: CNTS = counts DENS = density MANU = manual OVFL = data overflow TIME = time TRIG = physiological trigger See C.8.4.9.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Table Height
entry.description: The height of the patient table in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: Table Traverse
entry.description: Location of the patient table (or gantry relative to the table) in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Elapsed time for data acquisition in msec. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is: WHOLE BODY or STATIC. See C.8.4.9.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Count Rate
entry.description: Maximum count rate achieved during the acquisition in counts/sec.

entry.name: Processing Function
entry.description: Code or description of processing functions applied to the data.

entry.name: Corrected Image
entry.description: A value that indicates which, if any, corrections have been applied to the image. Corrections are applied to all frames in the image. Defined Terms: UNIF = flood corrected COR = center of rotation corrected NCO = non-circular orbit corrected DECY = decay corrected ATTN = attenuation corrected SCAT = scatter corrected DTIM = dead time corrected NRGY = energy corrected LIN = linearity corrected MOTN = motion corrected CLN = count loss normalization; Any type of normalization applied to correct for count loss in Time Slots.

entry.name: Whole Body Technique
entry.description: The type of scan performed. Used only if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, contains the value WHOLE BODY. Enumerated Values: 1PS = one pass 2PS = two pass PCN = patient contour following employed MSP = multiple static frames collected into a whole body frame.

entry.name: Scan Velocity
entry.description: The speed of the camera motion over the body in mm/sec. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 contains the value WHOLE BODY.

entry.name: Scan Length
entry.description: Size of the imaged area in the direction of scanning motion, in mm. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 contains the value WHOLE BODY.

entry.name: Trigger Source or Type
entry.description: Text indicating trigger source. Defined Term: EKG

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7 No Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is defined.

entry.name: Energy Window Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe the energy window groups used. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Energy Windows (0054,0011). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Energy Window Vector (0054,0010), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Energy Window Name
entry.description: A user defined name which describes this Energy Window.

entry.name: >Energy Window Range Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes this energy window group.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Lower Limit
entry.description: The lower limit of the energy window in KeV. See C.8.4.10.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Upper Limit
entry.description: The upper limit of the energy window in KeV. See C.8.4.10.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Radiopharmaceutical Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe isotope information. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Radionuclide Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radionuclide. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Required if a sequence Item is present.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 18. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of “99SDM” for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Route
entry.description: Route of injection.

entry.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the administration route for the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Volume
entry.description: Volume of injection in cubic cm.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Start Time
entry.description: Time of start of injection. See C.8.4.10.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Stop Time
entry.description: Time of end of injection. See C.8.4.10.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Radionuclide Total Dose
entry.description: Total amount of radionuclide injected. See C.8.4.10.1.7 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Calibration Data Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that contains calibration data.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Number
entry.description: The Item number in the Energy Window Information Sequence to which the following calibration data relates. The Items are numbered starting from 1. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Syringe Counts
entry.description: Pre-injection syringe count rate in counts/sec. See C.8.4.10.1.8 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Residual Syringe Counts
entry.description: Post-injection residue syringe count rate in counts/sec. See C.8.4.10.1.9 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical
entry.description: Name of the radiopharmaceutical.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 25. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Intervention Drug Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes the intervention drugs used. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Name
entry.description: Name of intervention drug.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the intervention drug name.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 10. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the administration route for the intervention drug. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Start Time
entry.description: Time of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for the Acquisition Start Time (0008,0032).

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Stop Time
entry.description: Time of completion of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for the Acquisition Start Time (0008,0032).

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Dose
entry.description: Intervention drug dose, in mg.

entry.name: Detector Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe the detectors used. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Detectors (0054,0021). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Detector Vector (0054,0020), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Collimator/Grid Name
entry.description: Label describing the collimator used (LEAP, hires, etc.)

entry.name: >Collimator Type
entry.description: Collimator type. Defined Terms: PARA = Parallel (default) PINH = Pinhole FANB = Fan-beam CONE = Cone-beam SLNT = Slant hole ASTG = Astigmatic DIVG = Diverging NONE = No collimator UNKN = Unknown Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Field of View Shape
entry.description: Shape of the field of view of the Nuclear Medicine detector. Defined Terms: RECTANGLE ROUND HEXAGONAL

entry.name: >Field of View Dimension(s)
entry.description: Dimensions of the field of view, in mm. If Field of View Shape (0018,1147) is: RECTANGLE: row dimension followed by column. ROUND: diameter. HEXAGONAL: diameter of a circumscribed circle.

entry.name: >Focal Distance
entry.description: Focal distance, in mm. A value of 0 means infinite distance for parallel collimation. See C.8.4.11.1.1 for further specialization. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >X Focus Center
entry.description: Center of focus along a row. See C.8.4.11.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Y Focus Center
entry.description: Center of focus along a column. See C.8.4.11.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Zoom Center
entry.description: The amount of offset from (0,0) applied to each pixel in the image before application of the zoom factor, specified by a numeric pair: row value (delimiter) column value (in mm). See C.8.4.11.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Zoom Factor
entry.description: The amount of magnification applied to each pixel in the image, specified by a numeric pair: row value (delimiter) column value. See C.8.4.11.1.4 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Center of Rotation Offset
entry.description: Average center of rotation offset of Nuclear Medicine detector in mm. See C.8.4.11.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Gantry/Detector Tilt
entry.description: Angle of tilt in degrees of the detector. See C.8.4.11.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 4 is TRANSMISSION, Value 3 is not TOMO, and a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Start Angle
entry.description: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of the acquisition, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter-clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: > Radial Position
entry.description: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: >Image Orientation (Patient)
entry.description: The direction cosines of the first row and the first column with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Image Position (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates of the upper left hand corner (center of the first voxel transmitted) of the image, in mm. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >View Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the projection of the anatomic region of interest on the image receptor. See Section C.8.4.11.1.7 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 26 . Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >>View Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: View Modifier. Required if needed to fully specify the View. See Section C.8.4.11.1.8 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 23. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Rotation Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe TOMO rotational groups. A new rotation is defined whenever the direction of the detector motion changes, or the Table Traverse (0018,1131) changes. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Rotations (0054,0051). If Rotation Vector (0054,0050) is present, the first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Rotation Vector (0054,0050), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Start Angle
entry.description: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of this rotation, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter-clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Angular Step
entry.description: The angular scan arc step between views of the TOMO acquisition, in degrees. See C.8.4.12.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of rotation of the detector about the patient. See Start Angle (0054,0200) for further explanation of direction. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise (decreasing angle) CC = counter-clockwise (increasing angle). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Scan Arc
entry.description: The effective angular range of the scan data in degrees. The value shall be positive. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Nominal acquisition time per angular position, in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Radial Position
entry.description: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. It shall have a single value which is an average value for this rotation, or it shall have one value per angular view.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 4, is TRANSMISSION and a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Number of Frames in Rotation
entry.description: Number of angular views in this rotation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Table Traverse
entry.description: Location of the patient table (or gantry relative to the table) in mm.The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer.

entry.name: >Table Height
entry.description: The distance in mm of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation. Table height below the center of rotation has a positive value.

entry.name: Type of Detector Motion
entry.description: Describes the detector motion during acquisition. Enumerated Values: STEP AND SHOOT = Interrupted motion, acquire only while stationary. CONTINUOUS = Gantry motion and acquisition are simultaneous and continuous. ACQ DURING STEP = Interrupted motion, acquisition is continuous.

entry.name: Beat Rejection Flag
entry.description: Heart beat duration sorting has been applied. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no

entry.name: PVC Rejection
entry.description: Description of type of arrhythmic beat rejection criteria used.

entry.name: Skip Beats
entry.description: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia

entry.name: Heart Rate
entry.description: Average number of heart beats per minute for the collection period for these frames. This shall include all accepted beats as well as rejected beats.

entry.name: Gated Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe R-R intervals. Each gated interval is defined by an upper and lower range of heart beat durations. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). The number of items shall be equal to Number of R-R Intervals (0054,0061). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Trigger Time
entry.description: Time interval measured in msec from the start of the R-wave to the beginning of the data taking.

entry.name: >Framing Type
entry.description: Description of type of framing performed such as forward, backward, forward/backward by percentage.

entry.name: >Data Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe gating criteria. See C.8.4.13.1.1. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Frame Time
entry.description: Nominal time per individual frame in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Nominal Interval
entry.description: Average duration of accepted beats, in msec.

entry.name: >>Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval lower limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: >>High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval upper limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: >>Intervals Acquired
entry.description: Number of heartbeats that fall within Low R-R Value (0018,1081) and High R-R Value (0018,1082), and were therefore accepted and contribute gamma events to this R-R Interval.

entry.name: >>Intervals Rejected
entry.description: Number of heartbeats that fall outside Low R-R (0018,1081) and High R-R Value (0018,1082), and do not contribute gamma events to this R-R Interval. However, they may contribute gamma events to other R-R Intervals.

entry.name: >>Time Slot Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe Time Slot Information. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070). The number of items shall be equal to Number of Time Slots (0054,0071). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Time Slot Vector (0054,0070), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >>>Time Slot Time
entry.description: The total amount of time, in msec, that the acquisition accumulates gamma events into this frame. See C.8.4.13.1.2.

entry.name: Phase Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes each dynamic phase. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030). The number of items shall be equal to Number of Phases (0054,0031). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Phase Vector (0054,0030), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Phase Delay
entry.description: Time paused between the last frame of the previous phase and the first frame of this phase, in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Nominal time of acquisition per individual frame, in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Pause Between Frames
entry.description: Time paused between each frame of this phase (in msec). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Number of Frames in Phase
entry.description: Number of frames in this phase. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Trigger Vector
entry.description: An array of trigger times when gating information is acquired simultaneously with the dynamic image data. See Section C.8.4.14.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Number of Triggers in Phase
entry.description: The number of entries in the Trigger Vector (0054,0210) for this phase. Required if Trigger Vector (0054,0210) is present.

entry.name: >Phase Description
entry.description: Description of this phase of the Dynamic image. Defined Terms: FLOW WASHOUT UPTAKE EMPTYING EXCRETION

entry.name: Spacing Between Slices
entry.description: Spacing between slices, in mm, measured from center-to-center of each slice along the normal to the first image. The sign of the Spacing Between Slices (0018,0088) determines the direction of stacking. The normal is determined by the cross product of the direction cosines of the first row and first column of the first frame, such that a positive spacing indicates slices are stacked behind the first slice and a negative spacing indicates slices are stacked in front of the first slice. See Image Orientation (0020,0037) in the NM Detector module.

entry.name: Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: Diameter, in mm, of the region from within which the data was used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.

entry.name: Convolution Kernel
entry.description: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data.

entry.name: Slice Thickness
entry.description: Nominal slice thickness, in mm.

entry.name: Slice Location
entry.description: Relative position of exposure expressed in mm. See C.7.6.2.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Slice Progression Direction
entry.description: Describes the anatomical direction that slices are progressing as the slices are considered in order (as defined by the Slice Vector (0054,0080)). Meaningful only for cardiac images. When View Code Sequence (0054,0220) indicates a short axis view, then Enumerated Values are: APEX_TO_BASE BASE_TO_APEX

entry.name: Sequence of Ultrasound Regions
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Ultrasound Regions. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Region Location Min x0
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Region Location Min y0
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Region Location Max x1
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Region Location Max y1
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Physical Units X Direction
entry.description: The physical units of the dimensions of the region. See C.8.5.5.1.15 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: >Physical Units Y Direction
entry.description: The physical units of the dimensions of the region. See C.8.5.5.1.15 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: >Physical Delta X
entry.description: The physical value increments per positive X pixel increment. The units are as specified in the Physical Units X Direction (0018,6024). See C.8.5.5.1.17 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Physical Delta Y
entry.description: The physical value increments per positive Y pixel increment. The units are as specified in the Physical Units Y Direction (0018,6026). See C.8.5.5.1.17 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Reference Pixel x0
entry.description: This coordinate pair, x0,y0 defines the location of a virtual "reference" pixel. See C.8.5.5.1.16 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Reference Pixel y0
entry.description: This coordinate pair, x0,y0 defines the location of a virtual "reference" pixel. See C.8.5.5.1.16 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Ref. Pixel Physical Value X
entry.description: The Physical Value at the reference pixel x location. The units are specified in the Physical Units field.

entry.name: >Ref. Pixel Physical Value Y
entry.description: The Physical Value at the reference pixel y location. The units are specified in the Physical Units field.

entry.name: >Region Spatial Format
entry.description: The spatial organization of the data within the region. See C.8.5.5.1.1 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: >Region Data Type
entry.description: The type of data within the region. See C.8.5.5.1.2 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: >Region Flags
entry.description: Flags used for special handling of the region. See C.8.5.5.1.3 for Enumerated Values and further explanation.

entry.name: >Pixel Component Organization
entry.description: Describes how the components of a pixel can be described. Required if pixel component calibration exists for this region. See C.8.5.5.1.4 for Enumerated Values and further explanation.

entry.name: >Pixel Component Mask
entry.description: This value is ANDed with the composite pixel code for each pixel within the region, then shifted right by the number of contiguous least significant zeros in the mask to obtain what will be referred to as the "Shifted Masked Composite Pixel Code" (SMCPC). Required if Pixel Component Organization = Bit aligned. See C.8.5.5.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Pixel Component Range Start
entry.description: Defines the start of the numeric range of values within the composite pixel where calibration is to be defined by the "pixel physical calibration table". To be used only when ranges are used to describe the portion of the composite pixel. Required if Pixel Component Organization = Ranges.

entry.name: >Pixel Component Range Stop
entry.description: Defines the stop of the numeric range of values within the composite pixel where calibration is to be defined by the "pixel physical calibration table". To be used only when ranges are used to describe the portion of the composite pixel. Required if Pixel Component Organization = Ranges.

entry.name: >Pixel Component Physical Units
entry.description: The physical units to be applied to the pixel component. Required if Pixel Component Organization exists. See C.8.5.5.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Pixel Component Data Type
entry.description: The type of data for the pixel component. Required if Pixel Component Organization exists. See C.8.5.5.1.7 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Number of Table Break Points
entry.description: The number of break point coordinate pairs used to describe a piece wise linear curve. Required if Pixel Component Organization equals 0 or 1. Otherwise not used. See C.8.5.5.1.8 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table of X Break Points
entry.description: An array of X values used to create the piece wise linear curve. Required if Pixel Component Organization equals 0 or 1. Otherwise not used. See C.8.5.5.1.9 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table of Y Break Points
entry.description: An array of Y values used to create the piece wise linear curve. Required if Pixel Component Organization equals 0 or 1. Otherwise not used. See C.8.5.5.1.9 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Number of Table Entries
entry.description: The number of entries in the Table of Pixel Values. Required if the value of Pixel Component Organization (0018,6044) is 2 or 3. Otherwise not used. See C.8.5.5.1.11 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table of Pixel Values
entry.description: A table of Pixel Values used in conjunction with the Table of Parameter Values (0018,605A) or Pixel Value Mapping Code Sequence (0040,9098) to provide a mapping from Pixel Value to a real world value. Required if the Pixel Component Organization equals 2. Otherwise not used. See C.8.5.5.1.12 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table of Parameter Values
entry.description: A table of Parameter Values used in conjunction with the Table of Pixel Values (0018,6058) to provide a mapping from Pixel Value to Parameter Value. Required if the value of Pixel Component Organization (0018,6044) is 2. Otherwise not used. See C.8.5.5.1.13 for further explanation

entry.name: > Pixel Value Mapping Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that, in conjunction with the Table of Pixel Values (0018,6058), provides a mapping from a Pixel Value to an associated Coded Concept. One or more Items shall be present; the number of Items shall be equal to the value of Number of Table Entries (0018,6056). Required if the value of Pixel Component Organization (0018,6044) is 3 (Code Sequence look up). See Sections C.8.5.6.1.18 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID for IVUS is 3497; no Context ID is otherwise defined.

entry.name: >Tranducer Frequency
entry.description: The manufacturer defined description of center frequency of the interrogating ultrasound energy. The units are kilohertz.

entry.name: >Pulse Repetition Frequency
entry.description: The ultrasound pulse repetition frequency, as defined by the manufacturer, used to collect data in the region. The units are in hertz.

entry.name: >Doppler Correction Angle
entry.description: The Doppler correction angle. The units are degrees.

entry.name: >Steering Angle
entry.description: The steering angle, as defined by the manufacturer, used for a steered 2D image. The units are degrees.

entry.name: >Doppler Sample Volume X Position
entry.description: The x displacement, in pixels, from the Reference pixel to the center of the Doppler sample volume.

entry.name: >Doppler Sample Volume Y Position
entry.description: The y displacement, in pixels, from the Reference pixel to the center of the Doppler sample volume.

entry.name: >TM-Line Position x0
entry.description: The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the m-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the tm-line. See C.8.5.5.1.10 for further explanation.

entry.name: >TM-Line Position y0
entry.description: The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the m-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the tm-line. See C.8.5.5.1.10 for further explanation.

entry.name: >TM-Line Position x1
entry.description: The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the m-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the tm-line. See C.8.5.5.1.10 for further explanation.

entry.name: >TM-Line Position y1
entry.description: The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the m-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the tm-line. See C.8.5.5.1.10 for further explanation.

entry.name: Samples Per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.5.6.1.12 for specialization

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.5.6.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. See C.8.5.6.1.13 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. See C.8.5.6.1.14 for specialization.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. See C.8.5.6.1.15 for specialization.

entry.name: Planar Configuration
entry.description: Indicates whether the pixel data are sent color-by-plane or color-by-pixel. Required if Samples per Pixel (0028,0002) has a value greater than 1. See C.8.5.6.1.16 for specialization.

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of pixel samples. See C.8.5.6.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Frame Increment Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute which is used as the frame increment in Multi-frame pixel data (see C.7.6.6). Required if Number of Frames is sent. See C.8.5.6.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.5.6.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5 Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image.

entry.name: Number of Stages
entry.description: Number of Stages in this protocol. Required if image was acquired in a Staged protocol.

entry.name: Number of Views in Stage
entry.description: Number of views in this Stage. Required if image was acquired in a Staged protocol.

entry.name: R Wave Time Vector
entry.description: The time offset(s) of the reported R Wave peaks, each relative to the time of the start of the acquisition of the first frame in msec. Multi-valued, with one value per reported R Wave.

entry.name: Ultrasound Color Data Present
entry.description: This element indicates if any ultrasound color data is present in an image. Enumerated Values: 00 = Ultrasound color data not present in image 01 = Ultrasound color data is present in image. See C.8.5.6.10

entry.name: Stage Name
entry.description: A Stage is a particular time slice of a protocol in which a set of images are collected. The names can be free form text. Recommended text for Stress Echo stage names are: PRE-EXERCISE, POST-EXERCISE, PEAK-EXERCISE, RECOVERY, BASELINE, LOW DOSE, PEAK DOSE

entry.name: Stage Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of items describing the performed Ultrasound Protocol Stage(s).

include.ref: >Include “Code Sequence Macro” Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID is 12002.

entry.name: Stage Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Stage. Stage Number starts at one.

entry.name: View Name
entry.description: A View is a particular combination of the position and orientation when a set of images are acquired. Images are acquired at the same View in different Stages for the purpose of comparison.

entry.name: View Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the View. View Number starts at one.

entry.name: Number of Event Timers
entry.description: The number of event timers used at the time of acquisition of a Multi-frame image.

entry.name: Event Elapsed Time(s)
entry.description: An array of values associated with each event timer. Units in milliseconds.

entry.name: Event Timer Name(s)
entry.description: Name that identifies the event timer.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7 For intravascular ultrasound, DCIDs 3010 and 3015 are specified for the Anatomic Region Sequence and DCID 3019 is specified for the Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence. No other Context IDs are specified.

entry.name: View Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the view of the patient anatomy in this image. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence. See Section C.8.5.6.1.19.

include.ref: >Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 See Section C.8.5.6.1.19 for Context Group IDs.

entry.name: >View Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that provides modifiers for the view of the patient anatomy. Zero or more Items shall be permitted in this Sequence. See Section C.8.5.6.1.19.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 See Section C.8.5.6.1.19 for Context Group IDs.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started. Required if Modality (0008,0060) = IVUS May be present otherwise. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the Synchronization Module in Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800).

entry.name: Trigger Time
entry.description: Time interval measured in msec from the start of the R-wave to the beginning of data taking

entry.name: Nominal Interval
entry.description: Average R-R interval used for these data, in msec

entry.name: Beat Rejection Flag
entry.description: Beat length sorting has been applied. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no

entry.name: Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: Heart Rate
entry.description: Beats per minute.

entry.name: IVUS Acquisition
entry.description: Defined Terms: MOTOR_PULLBACK MANUAL_PULLBACK SELECTIVE GATED_PULLBACK See C.8.5.6.1.21 Required if Modality (0008,0060) = IVUS

entry.name: IVUS Pullback Rate
entry.description: Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is MOTOR_PULLBACK. Specified in units of mm/sec. See C.8.5.6.1.22

entry.name: IVUS Gated Rate
entry.description: Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is GATED_PULLBACK. Specified in units of mm/beat. See C.8.5.6.1.23

entry.name: IVUS Pullback Start Frame Number
entry.description: Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is MOTOR_PULLBACK or GATED_PULLBACK. See C.8.5.6.1.24

entry.name: IVUS Pullback Stop Frame Number
entry.description: Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is MOTOR_PULLBACK or GATED_PULLBACK. See C.8.5.6.1.25

entry.name: Lesion Number
entry.description: Identifier(s) of the lesion(s) of interest imaged within the current SOP Instance. Each lesion shall have a unique numeric integer identifier within the study. See C.8.5.6.1.26.

entry.name: Output Power
entry.description: Manufacturer defined character string description of ultrasound output level(s) used in generating a given image. Data may be expressed in dB, %, W/cm2, etc.

entry.name: Transducer Data
entry.description: Manufacturer defined code or description of ultrasound transducer used.

entry.name: Transducer Type
entry.description: Defined Terms: SECTOR_PHASED SECTOR_MECH SECTOR_ANNULAR LINEAR CURVED LINEAR SINGLE CRYSTAL SPLIT XTAL CWD IV_PHASED IV_ROT XTAL IV_ROT MIRROR ENDOCAV_PA ENDOCAV_MECH ENDOCAV_CLA ENDOCAV_AA ENDOCAV_LINEAR VECTOR_PHASED

entry.name: Focus Depth
entry.description: The depth, from the transducer face, of the manufacturer defined beam focus used for the image, in cm.

entry.name: Preprocessing Function
entry.description: Manufacturer defined description of processing of echo information. Data may include code or description of gain (initial, overall, TGC, dynamic range, etc.), preprocessing, postprocessing, Doppler processing parameters, e.g. cutoff filters, etc., as used in generating a given image.

entry.name: Mechanical Index
entry.description: See C.8.5.6.1.8 for Description.

entry.name: Bone Thermal Index
entry.description: See C.8.5.6.1.8 for Description.

entry.name: Cranial Thermal Index
entry.description: See C.8.5.6.1.8 for Description.

entry.name: Soft Tissue Thermal Index
entry.description: See C.8.5.6.1.8 for Description.

entry.name: Soft Tissue-focus Thermal Index
entry.description: See C.8.5.6.1.8 for Description.

entry.name: Soft Tissue-surface Thermal Index
entry.description: See C.8.5.6.1.8 for Description.

entry.name: Depth of Scan Field
entry.description: The depth, in mm, from the transducer face to the deepest point included in the displayed image– the field of view.

entry.name: Overlay Subtype
entry.description: Defined term which identifies the intended purpose of the ROI Overlay Type. See C.8.5.6.1.11 for specialization.

entry.name: Conversion Type
entry.description: Describes the kind of image conversion. Defined Terms : DV = Digitized Video DI = Digital Interface DF = Digitized Film WSD = Workstation SD = Scanned Document SI = Scanned Image DRW = Drawing SYN = Synthetic Image

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Source equipment for the image. This type definition shall override the definition in the General Series Module. See C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device ID
entry.description: User defined identification of the device that converted the image

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the Secondary Capture Device

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model number of the Secondary Capture Device

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device Software Version
entry.description: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the Secondary Capture Device

entry.name: Video Image Format Acquired
entry.description: Original format of the captured video image (e.g. NTSC, PAL, Videomed-H)

entry.name: Digital Image Format Acquired
entry.description: Additional information about digital interface used to acquire the image

entry.name: Date of Secondary Capture
entry.description: The date the Secondary Capture Image was captured.

entry.name: Time of Secondary Capture
entry.description: The time the Secondary Capture Image was captured.

entry.name: Nominal Scanned Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance on the media being digitized or scanned between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order. Shall be consistent with Pixel Aspect Ratio (0028,0034), if present.

include.ref: Include Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro (Table 10-10)

entry.name: Burned In Annotation
entry.description: Indicates whether or not image contains sufficient burned in annotation to identify the patient and date the image was acquired. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Presentation LUT Shape
entry.description: Specifies an identity transformation for the Presentation LUT, such that the output of all grayscale transformations defined in the IOD containing this Module are defined to be P-Values. Enumerated Values: IDENTITY - output is in P-Values. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and BitsStored (0028,0101) is greater than 1. Note: If the VOI LUT Module is required by the IOD but no VOI LUT Sequence (0028,3010) or Window Center (0028,1050) is present, then the VOI LUT stage is an identity transformation.

entry.name: Illumination
entry.description: Luminance of a hypothetical viewing device illuminating a piece of monochrome transmissive film, or for the case of reflective media, luminance obtainable from diffuse reflection of the illumination present. Expressed as L0, in candelas per square meter (cd/m2). Note: May be used together with Reflected Ambient Light (2010,0160) to recover Optical Density information from P-Values. See C.8.6.3.1.

entry.name: Reflected Ambient Light
entry.description: For scanned monochrome transmissive film viewed on a hypothetical viewing device, the luminance contribution due to reflected ambient light.
