entry.description: Location of a point in the image or Specified Displayed Area to which the Unformatted Text Value (0070,0006) is related, in Anchor Point Annotation Units (0070,0004), given as column\row. Column is the horizontal offset and row is the vertical offset. Required if Bounding Box Top Left Hand Corner (0070,0010) and Bounding Box Bottom Right Hand Corner (0070,0011) are not present. May be present even if a bounding box is specified (i.e. Bounding Box Top Left Hand Corner (0070,0010) and Bounding Box Bottom Right Hand Corner (0070,0011) are present).

entry.name: >>Anchor Point Visibility
entry.description: Flag to indicate whether or not a visible indication (such as a line or arrow) of the relationship between the text and the anchor point is to be displayed. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no Required if Anchor Point (0070,0014) is present.

entry.name: >Graphic Object Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes a graphic annotation. One or more Items may be present. Either one or both of Text Object Sequence (0070,0008) or Graphic Object Sequence (0070,0009) are required if the Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Graphic Annotation Units
entry.description: Units of measure for the axes of the graphic annotation. Enumerated Values for Graphic Annotation Units (0070,0005) are the same as for Bounding Box Annotation Units (0070,0003).

entry.name: >>Graphic Dimensions
entry.description: Enumerated Value: 2

entry.name: >>Number of Graphic Points
entry.description: Number of data points in this graphic.

entry.name: >> Graphic Data
entry.description: Coordinates that specify this graphic annotation. See C.10.5.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Graphic Type
entry.description: The shape of graphic that is to be drawn. See C.10.5.1.2. Enumerated Values: POINT POLYLINE INTERPOLATED CIRCLE ELLIPSE

entry.name: >>Graphic Filled
entry.description: Whether or not the closed graphics element is displayed as filled (in some unspecified manner that shall be distinguishable from an outline) or as an outline. See C.10.5.1.2. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no Required if Graphic Data (0070,0022) is “closed”, that is Graphic Type (0070,0023) is CIRCLE or ELLIPSE, or Graphic Type (0070,0023) is POLYLINE or INTERPOLATED and the first data point is the same as the last data point.

entry.name: Image Rotation
entry.description: How far to rotate the image clockwise in degrees, before any Image Horizontal Flip (0070,0041) is applied. Enumerated Values: 0, 90,180,270 Notes: Negative values are not permitted since the Value Representation is unsigned.

entry.name: Image Horizontal Flip
entry.description: Whether or not to flip the image horizontally after any Image Rotation has been applied such that the left side of the image becomes the right side. Enumerated Values: Y = yes, N = no Note: No vertical flip is specified since the same result can be achieved by a combination of a 180 degree rotation and a horizontal flip.

entry.name: Graphic Layer Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of Items each of which represents a single layer in which overlays, curves, graphics or text may be rendered. An Item is required for each layer referenced from the Graphic Annotation Module or the Overlay Activation Module.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer
entry.description: A string which identifies the layer. Note: This identifier may be used by other Attributes within the same presentation state instance to reference this layer. There is no requirement for the same identifiers to be used in different presentation states, and there is no mechanism for referencing layers in other presentation states. That is, a UID is not required.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Order
entry.description: An integer indicating the order in which it is recommended that the layer be rendered, if the display is capable of distinguishing. Lower numbered layers are to be rendered first.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Recommended Display Grayscale Value
entry.description: A default single gray unsigned value in which it is recommended that the layer be rendered on a monochrome display. The units are specified in P-Values from a minimum of 0000H (black) up to a maximum of FFFFH (white). Note: The maximum P-Value for this Attribute may be different from the maximum P-Value from the output of the Presentation LUT, which may be less than 16 bits in depth.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Recommended Display CIELab Value
entry.description: A default color triplet value in which it is recommended that the layer be rendered on a color display. The units are specified in PCS-Values, and the value is encoded as CIELab. See C.10.7.1.1.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Description
entry.description: A free text description of the contents of this layer.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Waveform.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the Waveform data was created.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the Waveform data was created.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this waveform started; the reference timestamp for the Multiplex Group Time Offset (0018,1068) for a waveform multiplex group Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the Synchronization Module in Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800).

entry.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides reference to a set of SOP Class/Instance pairs significantly related to this Waveform. One or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Code describing the purpose of the reference to the Instance(s). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is CID 7004 for referenced waveforms.

entry.name: Waveform Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of one or more Items, each representing one waveform multiplex group. Ordering of Items in this Sequence is significant for external reference to specific multiplex groups.

entry.name: > Multiplex Group Time Offset
entry.description: Offset time in milliseconds from a reference time (see C.10.9.1.1). Required if Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800) value is Y; may be present otherwise.

entry.name: > Trigger Time Offset
entry.description: Offset time in milliseconds from a synchronization trigger to the first sample of a waveform multiplex group. May be positive or negative. Required if waveform acquisition is synchronized to a trigger.

entry.name: > Trigger Sample Position
entry.description: Sample number whose time corresponds to a synchronization trigger (see C.10.9.1.2).

entry.name: > Waveform Originality
entry.description: See C.10.9.1.3. Enumerated values: ORIGINAL DERIVED

entry.name: > Number of Waveform Channels
entry.description: Number of channels for this multiplex group.

entry.name: > Number of Waveform Samples
entry.description: Number of samples per channel in this multiplex group.

entry.name: > Sampling Frequency
entry.description: Frequency in Hz

entry.name: > Multiplex Group Label
entry.description: Label for multiplex group

entry.name: > Channel Definition Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of one or more Items, with one Item per channel (see C.10.9.1.4). Ordering of Items in this Sequence is significant for reference to specific channels.

entry.name: >> Waveform Channel Number
entry.description: Equipment physical channel number used for acquisition.

entry.name: >> Channel Label
entry.description: Text label for channel which may be used for display purposes

entry.name: >> Channel Status
entry.description: One or more values for the status of this channel within this SOP Instance. Defined terms: OK TEST DATA DISCONNECTED QUESTIONABLE INVALID UNCALIBRATED UNZEROED Precise location of a change in status may be noted in an Annotation.

entry.name: >> Channel Source Sequence
entry.description: A coded descriptor of the waveform channel source (metric, anatomical position, function, and technique). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. (See C.10.9.1.4.1)

include.ref: >>> Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID determined by IOD specialization

entry.name: >> Channel Source Modifiers Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of one or more Items which further qualify the Waveform Source. Required if Channel Source Sequence (003A,0208) does not fully specify the semantics of the source. Ordering of Items in this Sequence may be semantically significant.

include.ref: >>> Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID determined by IOD specialization

entry.name: >> Source Waveform Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides reference to a DICOM waveform from which this channel was derived. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >>>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>> Referenced Waveform Channels
entry.description: Identifies the waveform multiplex group and channel within the referenced SOP Instance. Pair of values (M,C). Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >> Channel Derivation Description
entry.description: Additional description of waveform channel derivation

entry.name: >> Channel Sensitivity
entry.description: Nominal numeric value of unit quantity of sample. Required if samples represent defined (not arbitrary) units.

entry.name: >> Channel Sensitivity Units Sequence
entry.description: A coded descriptor of the Units of measure for the Channel Sensitivity. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. (see C.10.9.1.4.2) Required if Channel Sensitivity (003A,0210) is present.

include.ref: >>> Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Defined Context ID = 3082

entry.name: >> Channel Sensitivity Correction Factor
entry.description: Multiplier to be applied to encoded sample values to match units specified in Channel Sensitivity (003A,0210) (e.g., based on calibration data) (see C.10.9.1.4.2) Required if Channel Sensitivity (003A,0210) is present.

entry.name: >> Channel Baseline
entry.description: Offset of encoded sample value 0 from actual 0 using the units defined in the Channel Sensitivity Units Sequence (003A,0211). Required if Channel Sensitivity (003A,0210) is present.

entry.name: >> Channel Time Skew
entry.description: Offset of first sample of channel from waveform multiplex group start time, in seconds (see C.10.9.1.4.3) Required if Channel Sample Skew is not present.

entry.name: >> Channel Sample Skew
entry.description: Offset of first sample of channel from waveform multiplex group start time, in samples (see C.10.9.1.4.3) Required if Channel Time Skew is not present.

entry.name: >> Channel Offset
entry.description: Additional offset of first sample of channel to be used in aligning multiple channels for presentation or analysis, in seconds (see C.10.9.1.4.3)

entry.name: >> Waveform Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of significant bits within the waveform samples (see C.10.9.1.4.4)

entry.name: >> Filter Low Frequency
entry.description: Nominal 3dB point of lower frequency of pass band; in Hz

entry.name: >> Filter High Frequency
entry.description: Nominal 3dB point of upper frequency of pass band; in Hz

entry.name: >> Notch Filter Frequency
entry.description: Center frequency of notch filter(s); in Hz

entry.name: >> Notch Filter Bandwidth
entry.description: Nominal 3dB bandwidth of notch filter(s); in Hz

entry.name: >> Channel Minimum Value
entry.description: Minimum valid sample value as limited by the acquisition equipment (see C.10.9.1.4.5)

entry.name: >> Channel Maximum Value
entry.description: Maximum valid sample value as limited by the acquisition equipment (see C.10.9.1.4.5)

entry.name: > Waveform Bits Allocated
entry.description: Size of each waveform data sample within the Waveform Data; see section C.10.9.1.5

entry.name: > Waveform Sample Interpretation
entry.description: Data representation of the waveform data points. See C.10.9.1.5.

entry.name: > Waveform Padding Value
entry.description: Value of waveform samples inserted in channels when input is absent or invalid. Required if acquisition equipment inserts padding. See C.10.9.1.6.

entry.name: > Waveform Data
entry.description: Encoded data samples - channel multiplexed See section C.10.9.1.7

entry.name: Waveform Annotation Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Annotation Items; one or more items shall be present

entry.name: > Unformatted Text Value
entry.description: Text Observation Value (annotation). Mutually exclusive with Concept Name Code Sequence (0040,A043)

entry.name: > Concept Name Code Sequence
entry.description: Code representing the fully specified name of the NUMERIC measurement or CODED concept. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Mutually exclusive with Text Value (0070,0006).

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID may be defined in IOD definition.

entry.name: >> Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of items modifying or specializing the Concept Name. Any number of items may be present. Required if Concept Name Code Sequence (0040,A043) is sent and the value does not fully describe the semantics of the measurement or concept.

include.ref: >>>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID may be defined in IOD definition.

entry.name: > Concept Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the categorical coded nominal value.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID may be defined in IOD definition.

entry.name: >> Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of items modifying or specializing the Concept. Any number of items may be present. Required if Concept Code Sequence (0040,A168) is sent and the value does not fully describe the semantics of the concept value.

include.ref: >>>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID may be defined in IOD definition.

entry.name: > Numeric Value
entry.description: Numeric measurement value or values.

entry.name: > Measurement Units Code Sequence
entry.description: Units of measurement. Coded entry sequence with one item only.

include.ref: >> Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID 82

entry.name: > Referenced Waveform Channels
entry.description: List of channels in waveform to which annotation applies. See C.10.10.1.1

entry.name: > Temporal Range Type
entry.description: See C.10.10.1.2 for Enumerated Values. Required if Annotation does not apply to entire Referenced Waveform Channels; shall not be present if Annotation applies to entire temporal extent of referenced channels.

entry.name: > Referenced Sample Positions
entry.description: List of samples within a multiplex group specifying temporal points for annotation. Position of first sample is 1. Required if Temporal Range Type (0040,A130) is present, and if Referenced Time Offsets (0040,A138) and Referenced Datetime (0040,A13A) are not present. See C.10.10.1.3

entry.name: > Referenced Time Offsets
entry.description: Specifies temporal points for annotation by number of seconds after start of data. Required if Temporal Range Type (0040,A130) is present, and if Referenced Sample Positions (0040,A132) and Referenced Datetime (0040,A13A) are not present.

entry.name: > Referenced Datetime
entry.description: Specifies temporal points for annotation by absolute time. Required if Temporal Range Type (0040,A130) is present, and if Referenced Sample Positions (0040,A132) and Referenced Time Offsets (0040,A138) are not present.

entry.name: > Annotation Group Number
entry.description: Number identifying associated annotations (see C.10.10.1.4).

include.ref: Include Modality LUT Macro Table C.11-1b

entry.name: Modality LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Modality LUTs. Only one Item may be present. Shall not be present if Rescale Intercept (0028,1052) is present.

entry.name: >LUT Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the LUT Data in this Sequence. See C.11.1.1 for further explanation. Required if the Modality LUT Sequence (0028,3000) is sent.

entry.name: >LUT Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >Modality LUT Type
entry.description: Specifies the output values of this Modality LUT. See C.11.1.1.2 for further explanation. Required if the Modality LUT Sequence (0028,3000) is sent.

entry.name: >LUT Data
entry.description: LUT Data in this Sequence. Required if the Modality LUT Sequence (0028,3000) is sent.

entry.name: Rescale Intercept
entry.description: The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and the output units specified in Rescale Type (0028,1054). Output units = m*SV + b. Required if Modality LUT Sequence (0028,3000) is not present. Shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: Rescale Slope
entry.description: m in the equation specified by Rescale Intercept (0028,1052). Required if Rescale Intercept is present.

entry.name: Rescale Type
entry.description: Specifies the output units of Rescale Slope (0028,1053) and Rescale Intercept (0028,1052). See C.11.1.1.2 for further explanation. Required if Rescale Intercept is present.

include.ref: Include VOI LUT Macro Table C.11-2b

entry.name: VOI LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of VOI LUTs. One or more Items shall be present. Required if Window Center (0028,1050) is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >LUT Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the LUT Data in this Sequence. See C.11.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >LUT Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >LUT Data
entry.description: LUT Data in this Sequence.

entry.name: Window Center
entry.description: Window Center for display. See C.11.2.1.2 for further explanation. Required if VOI LUT Sequence (0028,3010) is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Window Width
entry.description: Window Width for display. See C.11.2.1.2 for further explanation. Required if Window Center (0028,1050) is sent.

entry.name: Window Center & Width Explanation
entry.description: Free form explanation of the meaning of the Window Center and Width. Multiple values correspond to multiple Window Center and Width values.

entry.name: VOI LUT Function
entry.description: Describes a VOI LUT function to apply to the values of Window Center (0028,1050) and Window Width (0028,1051). See C.11.2.1.3 for further explanation. Defined terms: LINEAR SIGMOID When this attribute is not present, the interpretation of the values of Window Center (0028,1050) and Window Width (0028,1051) is linear as in C.11.2.1.2.

entry.name: Presentation LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Presentation LUTs. Only a single item shall be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >LUT Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the LUT Data in this Sequence. Required if Presentation LUT Sequence (2050,0010) is sent. See C.11.4.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >LUT Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >LUT Data
entry.description: LUT Data in this Sequence.

entry.name: Presentation LUT Shape
entry.description: Specifies pre-defined Presentation LUT shapes. Enumerated Values : IDENTITY = input to the Presentation LUT is in P-Values, no further translation is necessary. LIN OD = input to Presentation LUT is in linear optical density over the range of Min Density (2010,0120) and Max Density (2010,1030). Note: LIN OD is only defined for hardcopy devices and is not applicable to softcopy devices.

entry.name: Histogram Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Histograms. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Histogram Number of Bins
entry.description: The number of “bins” (entries) in the histogram. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Histogram First Bin Value
entry.description: The stored pixel value corresponding to the lowest pixel value counted in the first bin. All image pixel values less than this value are not included in the histogram. Required if a Sequence Item is present. Note: The Value Representation of this Attribute is determined by the value of Pixel Representation (0028,0103).

entry.name: >Histogram Last Bin Value
entry.description: The stored pixel value corresponding to the highest pixel value counted in the last bin. All image pixel values greater than this value are not included in the histogram. Required if a Sequence Item is present. Note: The Value Representation of this Attribute is determined by the value of Pixel Representation (0028,0103).

entry.name: >Histogram Bin Width
entry.description: The number of consecutive stored pixel values included in a bin. All bins shall be of equal width. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Histogram Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >Histogram Data
entry.description: Histogram Data encoded as 32 bit unsigned counts of the number of pixel values in each bin. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: Presentation LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Presentation LUTs. Only a single item shall be included in this sequence. Required if Presentation LUT Shape (2050,0020) is absent.

entry.name: >LUT Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the LUT Data in this Sequence. See C.11.6.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >LUT Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >LUT Data
entry.description: LUT Data in this Sequence. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: Presentation LUT Shape
entry.description: Specifies predefined Presentation LUT transformation. Required if Presentation LUT Sequence (2050,0010) is absent. Enumerated Values: IDENTITY - no further translation necessary, input values are P-Values INVERSE - output values after inversion are P-Values See C.11.6.1.2.

entry.name: Overlay Activation Layer
entry.description: The layer (defined in Graphic Layer (0070,0002) of the Graphic Layer Module C.10.7) in which the Overlay described in group 60xx shall be displayed. If no layer is specified (zero length) then the overlay shall not be displayed. Required if Group 60xx is present in the referenced image(s) or the Presentation State instance containing this Module.

entry.name: Softcopy VOI LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of VOI LUTs or Window Centers and Widths and to which images and frames they apply. No more than one VOI LUT Sequence containing a single Item or one pair of Window Center/Width values shall be specified for each image or frame. One or more Items shall be present.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items where each Item provides reference to a selected set of Image SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are defined in the Presentation State Module, to which this VOI LUT or Window Center and Width applies. Required if the VOI LUT transformation in this Item does not apply to all the images listed in the Presentation State Module.

include.ref: >>Include Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Table 10-3
>Include VOI LUT Macro Table C.11-2b

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data. Enumerated Value: PR = Presentation State See C.7.3.1.1.1.

entry.name: Presentation Creation Date
entry.description: Date on which this presentation was created. Note: This date may be different from the date that the DICOM SOP Instance was created, since the presentation state information contained may have been recorded earlier.

entry.name: Presentation Creation Time
entry.description: Time at which this presentation was created. Note: This time may be different from the time that the DICOM SOP Instance was created, since the presentation state information contained may have been recorded earlier.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12 Note: The Content Label value may be used by an application as a Defined Term in order to imply some grouping of different presentation states, i.e. it may have the same value for different presentation state instances that share some common concept.
Include Presentation State Relationship Macro Table C.11.11-1b

entry.name: Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items where each Item includes the Attributes of one Series to which the Presentation applies. One or more Items shall be present.

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of a Series that is part of the Study defined by the Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in the enclosing dataset. Note: The Study Instance UID (0020,000D) will be that of the presentation state itself, unless the macro is invoked from the Blending Sequence (0070,0402) in the Presentation State Blending Module, in which case it will be explicitly specified.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items where each Item provides reference to a selected set of Image SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs to which the Presentation applies that are part of the Study defined by Study Instance UID (0020,000D) and the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E). One or more Items shall be present. The referenced SOP Class shall be the same for all Images in any Item of this Referenced Series Sequence (0008,1115).

include.ref: >>Include Image SOP Instance Reference Macro, Table 10-3

entry.name: Shutter Presentation Value
entry.description: A single grayscale unsigned value used to replace those parts of the image occluded by the shutter, when rendered on a monochrome display. The units are specified in P-Values. Required if the Display Shutter Module or Bitmap Display Shutter Module is present. Note: The requirement in this module is type 1C which overrides the type 3 in the Display Shutter Module.

entry.name: Shutter Presentation Color CIELab Value
entry.description: A color triplet value used to replace those parts of the image occluded by the shutter, when rendered on a color display. The units are specified in PCS-Values, and the value is encoded as CIELab. See C.10.7.1.1. Required if the Display Shutter Module or Bitmap Display Shutter Module is present and the SOP Class is other than Grayscale Softcopy Presentation State Storage. Note: The requirement in this module is type 1C, which overrides the type 3 in the Display Shutter and Bitmap Display Shutter Modules.

entry.name: Mask Subtraction Sequence
entry.description: Required if Mask Module is present. Only one Item shall be present. Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102) shall not be included in the Sequence Item. See C.7.6.10 for a complete definition of the Attributes in the Items of this Sequence other than Mask Operation(0028,6101) and Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102). Notes: 1. This Sequence is replicated here in order to specify one Item, additional conditions on Mask Operation (0028,6101) and to forbid Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102). 2. The role of Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102) is replaced by Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160).

entry.name: >Mask Operation
entry.description: Type of mask operation to be performed Enumerated Values: AVG_SUB TID See C.7.6.10.1 for further explanation. Note: The requirement in this module is for Enumerated Values which override the requirements of the Mask Module.

entry.name: >Contrast Frame Averaging
entry.description: Specified the number of contrast frames to average together before performing the mask operation. Required if Mask Frame Numbers (0028,6110) specifies more than one frame (i.e. is multi-valued). Note: The requirement in this module is conditional and overrides the optional requirements of the Mask Module.

entry.name: Recommended Viewing Mode
entry.description: Specifies the recommended viewing protocol(s). Enumerated Value: SUB = for subtraction with mask images Required if Mask Subtraction Sequence (0028,6100) is present. Note: The requirement in this module is type 1C and an Enumerated Value is specified which override the requirements of the Mask Module.

entry.name: Blending Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence of exactly two Items, one identifying and describing transformations upon a set of underlying grayscale images, and the other identifying and describing transformations upon a set of superimposed grayscale images. See C.11.14.1.1.

entry.name: >Blending Position
entry.description: Whether or not the contents of the Item represent the superimposed or underlying image set. Enumerated Values: SUPERIMPOSED UNDERLYING

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study that contains the images, which may differ from the Study in which the presentation state is contained.

include.ref: >Include Presentation State Relationship Macro Table C.11.11-1b
>Include Modality LUT Macro Table C.11-1b

entry.name: >Softcopy VOI LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of VOI LUTs or Window Centers and Widths and to which images and frames they apply. No more than one VOI LUT Sequence containing a single Item or one pair of Window Center/Width values shall be specified for each image or frame. One or more Items shall be present.

entry.name: >>Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items identifying images that are defined in the enclosing Item of the Blending Sequence (0070,0402), to which this VOI LUT or Window Center and Width applies. Required if the VOI LUT transformation in this Item does not apply to all the images in the enclosing Item of the Blending Sequence (0070,0402).

include.ref: >>>Include Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Table 10-3
>>Include VOI LUT Macro Table C.11-2b

entry.name: Relative Opacity
entry.description: A value from 0.0 to 1.0 indicating the relative opacity of the pixels of the superimposed image, where 1.0 means that pixels of the superimposed image completely replace the pixels of the underlying image, and 0.0 means that the pixels of the underlying image completely replace the pixels of the superimposed image. See PS 3.4 for a detailed description of the blending operation.

entry.name: Referenced Spatial Registration Sequence
entry.description: A reference to Spatial Registration Instances that may be used to register the underlying and superimposed images. Zero or more Items may be present. Note: A Spatial Registration Instance may identify registration between frames of reference, or between explicitly identified images. In the latter case, the list of images referenced by the Presentation State, not the list of images referenced by the Spatial Registration Instance, are to be blended.

include.ref: >Include SOP Instance Reference Macro Table C.17-3

entry.name: ICC Profile
entry.description: An ICC Profile encoding the transformation of device-dependent color stored pixel values into PCS-Values.

entry.name: SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Class. See C.12.1.1.1 for further explanation. See also PS 3.4.

entry.name: SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Instance. See C.12.1.1.1 for further explanation. See also PS 3.4.

entry.name: Specific Character Set
entry.description: Character Set that expands or replaces the Basic Graphic Set. Required if an expanded or replacement character set is used. See C.12.1.1.2 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Instance Creation Date
entry.description: Date the SOP Instance was created.

entry.name: Instance Creation Time
entry.description: Time the SOP Instance was created.

entry.name: Instance Creator UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies device which created the SOP Instance.

entry.name: Related General SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a Related General SOP Class for the SOP Class of this Instance. See PS 3.4.

entry.name: Original Specialized SOP Class UID
entry.description: The SOP Class in which the Instance was originally encoded, but which has been replaced during a fall-back conversion to the current Related General SOP Class. See PS 3.4.

entry.name: Coding Scheme Identification Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of items that map values of Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) to an external coding system registration, or to a private or local coding scheme. One or more items may be present in the sequence.

entry.name: >Coding Scheme Designator
entry.description: The value of a Coding Scheme Designator, used in this SOP Instance, which is being mapped.

entry.name: >Coding Scheme Registry
entry.description: The name of the external registry where further definition of the identified coding scheme may be obtained. Required if coding scheme is registered. Defined term: HL7

entry.name: >Coding Scheme UID
entry.description: The coding scheme UID identifier. Required if coding scheme is identified by an ISO 8824 object identifier compatible with the UI VR.

entry.name: >Coding Scheme External ID
entry.description: The coding scheme identifier as defined in an external registry. Required if coding scheme is registered and Coding Scheme UID (0008,010C) is not present.

entry.name: >Coding Scheme Name
entry.description: The coding scheme full common name

entry.name: >Coding Scheme Version
entry.description: The coding scheme version associated with the Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102).

entry.name: >Responsible Organization
entry.description: Name of the organization responsible for the Coding Scheme. May include organizational contact information.

entry.name: Timezone Offset From UTC
entry.description: Contains the offset from UTC to the timezone for all DA and TM Attributes present in this SOP Instance. Encoded as an ASCII string in the format “&ZZZZ”. The components of this string, from left to right, are & = “+” or “-”, and ZZZZ = Hours and Minutes of offset. Notes: 1. This encoding is the same as described in PS 3.5 for the DT Value Representation. 2. This Attribute does not apply to values with a DT Value Representation, which may contain an explicitly encoded timezone. 3. The corrected time may cross a 24 hour boundary. For example, if Local Time = 1.00 a.m. and Offset = +0200, then UTC = 11.00 p.m. (23.00) the day before. 4. The “+” sign may not be omitted. Time earlier than UTC is expressed as a negative offset. Note: For example: UTC = 5.00 a.m. Local Time = 3.00 a.m. Offset = -0200 The local timezone offset is undefined if this Attribute is absent.

entry.name: Contributing Equipment Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items containing descriptive attributes of related equipment which has contributed to the acquisition, creation or modification of the composite instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence. See C.12.1.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the related equipment is being reference. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. See C.12.1.1.5 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID 7005.

entry.name: >Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment that contributed to the composite instance.

entry.name: >Institution Name
entry.description: Institution where the equipment that contributed to the composite instance is located.

entry.name: >Institution Address
entry.description: Address of the institution where the equipment that contributed to the composite instance is located.

entry.name: >Station Name
entry.description: User defined name identifying the machine that contributed to the composite instance.

entry.name: >Institutional Department Name
entry.description: Department in the institution where the equipment that contributed to the composite instance is located.

entry.name: >Manufacturer’s Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer’s model name of the equipment that contributed to the composite instance.

entry.name: >Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer’s serial number of the equipment that contributed to the composite instance.

entry.name: >Software Versions
entry.description: Manufacturer’s designation of the software version of the equipment that contributed to the composite instance.

entry.name: >Spatial Resolution
entry.description: The inherent limiting resolution in mm of the acquisition equipment for high contrast objects for the data gathering and reconstruction technique chosen. If variable across the images of the series, the value at the image center.

entry.name: >Date of Last Calibration
entry.description: Date when the image acquisition device calibration was last changed in any way. Multiple entries may be used for additional calibrations at other times. See C.7.5.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Time of Last Calibration
entry.description: Time when the image acquisition device calibration was last changed in any way. Multiple entries may be used. See C.7.5.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Contribution DateTime
entry.description: The Date & Time when the equipment contributed to the composite instance.

entry.name: >Contribution Description
entry.description: Description of the contribution the equipment made to the composite instance.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Composite object instance.

entry.name: SOP Instance Status
entry.description: A flag that indicates the storage status of the SOP Instance. Not Specified (NS) implies that this SOP Instance has no special storage status, and hence no special actions need be taken. Original (OR) implies that this is the primary SOP instance for the purpose of storage, but that it has not yet been authorized for diagnostic use. Authorized Original (AO) implies that this is the primary SOP instance for the purpose of storage, which has been authorized for diagnostic use. Any copies of an Authorized Original should be given the status of Authorized Copy. Authorized Copy (AC) implies that this is a copy of an Authorized Original SOP Instance. Enumerated Values: NS, OR, AO, AC Note: Proper use of these flags is specified in Security Profiles. Implementations that do not conform to such Security Profiles may not necessarily handle these flags properly.

entry.name: SOP Authorization Date and Time
entry.description: The date and time when the SOP Instance Status (0100,0410) was set to AO.

entry.name: SOP Authorization Comment
entry.description: Any comments associated with the setting of the SOP Instance Status (0100,0410) to AO.

entry.name: Authorization Equipment Certification Number
entry.description: The certification number issued to the Application Entity that set the SOP Instance Status (0100,0410) to AO.

include.ref: Include ‘Digital Signatures Macro’ Table C.12-5

entry.name: Encrypted Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items containing encrypted DICOM data. One or more Items shall be present. Required if application level confidentiality is needed and certain recipients are allowed to decrypt all or portions of the Encrypted Attributes Data Set. See C.12.1.1.4.1.

entry.name: >Encrypted Content Transfer Syntax UID
entry.description: Transfer Syntax used to encode the encrypted content. Only Transfer Syntaxes that explicitly include the VR and use Little Endian encoding shall be used.

entry.name: >Encrypted Content
entry.description: Encrypted data. See C.12.1.1.4.2.

entry.name: Original Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items containing all attributes that were removed or replaced by other values in the main dataset. One or more Items may be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Source of Previous Values
entry.description: The source that provided the SOP Instance prior to the removal or replacement of the values. For example, this might be the Institution from which imported SOP Instances were received.

entry.name: >Attribute Modification Datetime
entry.description: Date and time the attributes were removed and/or replaced.

entry.name: >Modifying System
entry.description: Identification of the system which removed and/or replaced the attributes.

entry.name: >Reason for the Attribute Modification
entry.description: Reason for the attribute modification. Defined terms are: COERCE = Replace values of attributes such as Patient Name, ID, Accession Number, for example, during import of media from an external institution, or reconciliation against a master patient index. CORRECT = Replace incorrect values, such as Patient Name or ID, for example, when incorrect worklist item was chosen or operator input error.

entry.name: >Modified Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing a single item that contains all the Attributes that were modified or removed from the main data set.

include.ref: >>Any Attribute from the main data set that was modified or removed

entry.name: HL7 Structured Document Reference Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of items defining mapping and/or access mechanism for HL7 Structured Documents referenced from the current SOP Instance. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. See C.12.1.1.6. Required if HL7 Structured Documents are referenced within the Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the class of HL7 Structured Document.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the HL7 Structured Document as used in DICOM instance references.

entry.name: >HL7 Instance Identifier
entry.description: Instance Identifier of the referenced HL7 Structured Document, encoded as a UID (OID or UUID), concatenated with a caret (“^”) and Extension value (if Extension is present in Instance Identifier).

entry.name: >Retrieve URI
entry.description: Retrieval access path to HL7 Structured Document. Includes fully specified scheme, authority, path, and query in accordance with RFC 2396

entry.name: MAC Parameters Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of one or more items that describe the parameters used to calculate a MAC for use in Digital Signatures.

entry.name: >MAC ID Number
entry.description: A number used to identify this MAC Parameters Sequence item.

entry.name: >MAC Calculation Transfer Syntax UID
entry.description: The Transfer Syntax UID used to encode the values of the Data Elements included in the MAC calculation. Only Transfer Syntaxes that explicitly include the VR and use Little Endian encoding shall be used. Notes: Certain Transfer Syntaxes, particularly those that are used with compressed data, allow the fragmentation of the pixel data to change. If such fragmentation changes, Digital Signatures generated with such Transfer Syntaxes could become invalid.

entry.name: >MAC Algorithm
entry.description: The algorithm used in generating the MAC to be encrypted to form the Digital Signature. Defined Terms: RIPEMD160 MD5 SHA1 . Note: Digital Signature Security Profiles (see PS 3.15) may require the use of a restricted subset of these terms.

entry.name: >Data Elements Signed
entry.description: A list of Data Element Tags in the order they appear in the Data Set which identify the Data Elements used in creating the MAC for the Digital Signature. See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.1.

entry.name: Digital Signatures Sequence
entry.description: Sequence holding one or more Digital Signatures.

entry.name: >MAC ID Number
entry.description: A number used to identify which MAC Parameters Sequence item was used in the calculation of this Digital Signature.

entry.name: >Digital Signature UID
entry.description: A UID that can be used to uniquely reference this signature.

entry.name: >Digital Signature DateTime
entry.description: The date and time the Digital Signature was created. The time shall include an offset (i.e., time zone indication) from Coordinated Universal Time. Note: This is not a certified timestamp, and hence is not completely verifiable. An application can compare this date and time with those of other signatures and the validity date of the certificate to gain confidence in the veracity of this date and time.

entry.name: >Certificate Type
entry.description: The type of certificate used in (0400,0115). Defined Term: X509_1993_SIG Note: Digital Signature Security Profiles (see PS 3.15) may require the use of a restricted subset of these terms.

entry.name: >Certificate of Signer
entry.description: A certificate that holds the identity of the entity producing this Digital Signature, that entity’s public key or key identifier, and the algorithm and associated parameters with which that public key is to be used. Algorithms allowed are specified in Digital Signature Security Profiles (see PS 3.15). Notes: 1. As technology advances, additional encryption algorithms may be allowed in future versions. Implementations should take this possibility into account. 2. When symmetric encryption is used, the certificate merely identifies which key was used by which entity, but not the actual key itself. Some other means (e.g., a trusted third party) must be used to obtain the key.

entry.name: >Signature
entry.description: The MAC generated as described in Section 12.2.1.1 and encrypted using the algorithm, parameters, and private key associated with the Certificate of the Signer (0400,0115). See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.2.

entry.name: >Certified Timestamp Type
entry.description: The type of certified timestamp used in the Certified Timestamp (0400,0310) Attribute. Required if Certified Timestamp (0400,0310) is present. Defined Terms: CMS_TSP – Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Time Stamp Protocol Note: Digital Signature Security Profiles (see PS 3.15) may require the use of a restricted subset of these terms.

entry.name: >Certified Timestamp
entry.description: A certified timestamp of the Digital Signature (0400,0120) Attribute Value, which shall be obtained when the Digital Signature is created. See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.3.

entry.name: >Digital Signature Purpose Code Sequence
entry.description: The purpose of this Digital Signature.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 7007

entry.name: Modified Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items containing all Attributes that were removed or replaced by “dummy values” in the main dataset during de-identification of the SOP instance. Upon reversal of the de-identification process, the Attributes are copied back into the main dataset, replacing any dummy values that might have been created. Only a single Item shall be present.

include.ref: > Any Attribute from the main dataset that was modified or removed during the de-identification process. 3

Include Series and Instance Reference Macro, Table 10-4. Identifies all Series within the Study of which this Instance is a part, which Series contain Instances that are referenced elsewhere in this Instance.

entry.name: Studies Containing Other Referenced Instances Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of items each identifying a Study other than the Study of which this Instance is a part, which Studies contain Instances that are referenced elsewhere in this Instance. One or more Items shall be present. Required if this Instance references Instances in other Studies.

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Study containing the referenced Instances.

include.ref: >Include Series and Instance Reference Macro, Table 10-4.

table.name: BASIC FILM SESSION PRESENTATION MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Number of Copies
entry.description: Number of copies to be printed for each film of the film session.

entry.name: Print Priority
entry.description: Specifies the priority of the print job. Enumerated Values: HIGH MED LOW

entry.name: Medium Type
entry.description: Type of medium on which the print job will be printed. Defined Terms: PAPER CLEAR FILM BLUE FILM MAMMO CLEAR FILM MAMMO BLUE FILM

entry.name: Film Destination
entry.description: Film destination. Defined Terms: MAGAZINE = the exposed film is stored in film magazine PROCESSOR = the exposed film is developed in film processor BIN_i = the exposed film is deposited in a sorter bin where “I” represents the bin number. Film sorter BINs shall be numbered sequentially starting from one and no maxiumu is placed on the number of BINs. The encoding of the BIN number shall not contain leading zeros.

entry.name: Film Session Label
entry.description: Human readable label that identifies the film session

entry.name: Memory Allocation
entry.description: Amount of memory allocated for the film session. Value is expressed in KB

entry.name: Owner ID
entry.description: Identification of the owner of the film session

table.name: BASIC FILM SESSION RELATIONSHIP MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Referenced Film Box Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence which provides references to a set of Film Box SOP Class/Instance pairs. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

table.name: BASIC FILM BOX PRESENTATION MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Image Display Format
entry.description: Type of image display format. Enumerated Values: STANDARD\C,R : film contains equal size rectangular image boxes with R rows of image boxes and C columns of image boxes; C and R are integers. ROW\R1,R2,R3, etc. : film contains rows with equal size rectangular image boxes with R1 image boxes in the first row, R2 image boxes in second row, R3 image boxes in third row, etc.; R1, R2, R3, etc. are integers. COL\C1,C2,C3, etc.: film contains columns with equal size rectangular image boxes with C1 image boxes in the first column, C2 image boxes in second column, C3 image boxes in third column, etc.; C1, C2, C3, etc. are integers. SLIDE : film contains 35mm slides; the number of slides for a particular film size is configuration dependent. SUPERSLIDE : film contains 40mm slides; the number of slides for a particular film size is configuration dependent. CUSTOM\i : film contains a customized ordering of rectangular image boxes; i identifies the image display format; the definition of the image display formats is defined in the Conformance Statement; i is an integer

entry.name: Annotation Display Format ID
entry.description: Identification of annotation display format. The definition of the annotation display formats and the annotation box position sequence are defined in the Conformance Statement

entry.name: Film Orientation
entry.description: Film orientation. Enumerated Values: PORTRAIT = vertical film position LANDSCAPE = horizontal film position

entry.name: Film Size ID
entry.description: Film size identification. Defined Terms: 8INX10IN 8_5INX11IN 10INX12IN 10INX14IN 11INX14IN 11INX17IN 14INX14IN 14INX17IN 24CMX24CM 24CMX30CM A4 A3 Note: 10INX14IN corresponds with 25.7CMX36.4CM A4 corresponds with 210 x 297 millimeters A3 corresponds with 297 x 420 millimeters

entry.name: Magnification Type
entry.description: Interpolation type by which the printer magnifies or decimates the image in order to fit the image in the image box on film. Defined Terms: REPLICATE BILINEAR CUBIC NONE

entry.name: Smoothing Type
entry.description: Further specifies the type of the interpolation function. Values are defined in Conformance Statement. Only valid for Magnification Type (2010,0060) = CUBIC

entry.name: Border Density
entry.description: Density of the film areas surrounding and between images on the film. Defined Terms: BLACK WHITE i where i represents the desired density in hundreds of OD (e.g. 150 corresponds with 1.5 OD)

entry.name: Empty Image Density
entry.description: Density of the image box area on the film that contains no image. Defined Terms: BLACK WHITE i where i represents the desired density in hundredths of OD (e.g. 150 corresponds with 1.5 OD)

entry.name: Min Density
entry.description: Minimum density of the images on the film, expressed in hundredths of OD. If Min Density is lower than minimum printer density than Min Density is set to minimum printer density.

entry.name: Max Density
entry.description: Maximum density of the images on the film, expressed in hundredths of OD. If Max Density is higher than maximum printer density than Max Density is set to maximum printer density.

entry.name: Trim
entry.description: Specifies whether a trim box shall be printed surrounding each image on the film. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Configuration Information
entry.description: Character string that contains either the ID of the printer configuration table that contains a set of values for implementation specific print parameters (e.g. perception LUT related parameters) or one or more configuration data values, encoded as characters. If there are multiple configuration data values encoded in the string, they shall be separated by backslashes. The definition of values shall be contained in the SCP's Conformance Statement. Defined Terms: CS000-CS999: Implementation specific curve type. Note: It is recommended that for SCPs, CS000 represent the lowest contrast and CS999 the highest contrast levels available.

entry.name: Illumination
entry.description: Luminance of lightbox illuminating a piece of transmissive film, or for the case of reflective media, luminance obtainable from diffuse reflection of the illumination present. Expressed as L0, in candelas per square meter (cd/m2).

entry.name: Reflected Ambient Light
entry.description: For transmissive film, luminance contribution due to reflected ambient light. Expressed as La, in candelas per square meter (cd/m2).

entry.name: Requested Resolution ID
entry.description: Specifies the resolution at which images in this Film Box are to be printed. Defined Terms: STANDARD = approximately 4k x 5k printable pixels on a 14 x 17 inch film HIGH = Approximately twice the resolution of STANDARD.

table.name: BASIC FILM BOX RELATIONSHIP MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Referenced Film Session Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides references to a Film Session SOP Class/Instance pairs. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Referenced Image Box Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides references to a set of Image Box SOP Class/Instance pairs. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Referenced Basic Annotation Box Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence which provides references to a set of Basic Annotation Box SOP Class/Instance pairs. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Referenced Presentation LUT Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides references to a Presentation LUT related SOP Class/Instance pairs. Only a single Item shall be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

table.name: IMAGE BOX PIXEL PRESENTATION MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Image Position
entry.description: The position of the image on the film, based on Image Display Format (2010,0010). See C.13.5.1 for specification.

entry.name: Polarity
entry.description: Specifies whether minimum pixel values (after VOI LUT transformation) are to printed black or white. Enumerated Values: NORMAL = pixels shall be printed as specified by the Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) REVERSE = pixels shall be printed with the opposite polarity as specified by the Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) If Polarity (2020,0020) is not specified by the SCU, the SCP shall print with NORMAL polarity.

entry.name: Magnification Type
entry.description: Description is the same as in Table C.13-3. Overrides the Magnification Type specified for the Film Box

entry.name: Smoothing Type
entry.description: Description is the same as in Table C.13-3. Overrides the Smoothing Type specified for the Film Box

entry.name: Configuration Information
entry.description: See Table C.13-3 for description of Configuration Information.

entry.name: Requested Image Size
entry.description: Width (x-dimension) in mm of the image to be printed. This value overrides the size that corresponds with optimal filling of the Image Box.

entry.name: Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior
entry.description: Specifies whether image pixels are to be decimated or cropped if the image rows or columns is greater than the available printable pixels in an Image Box. Decimation means that a magnification factor <1 is applied to the image. The method of decimation shall be that specified by Magnification Type (2010,0060) or the SCP default if not specified Cropping means that some image rows and/or columns are deleted before printing Enumerated Values: DECIMATE = a magnification factor <1 to be applied to the image. CROP = some image rows and/or columns are to be deleted before printing. The specific algorithm for cropping shall be described in the SCP Conformance Statement. FAIL = the SCP shall not crop or decimate

entry.name: Basic Grayscale Image Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides the content of the grayscale image pixel data to be printed. This is a specialization of the Image Pixel Module defined in C.7.6.3 of this part. It is encoded as a sequence of Attributes of the Image Pixel Module. Zero or one Item may be included in this Sequence. See PS 3.4 for further description.

entry.name: >Samples Per Pixel
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 1

entry.name: >Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Values: MONOCHROME1 MONOCHROME2

entry.name: >Rows
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module

entry.name: >Columns
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module

entry.name: >Pixel Aspect Ratio
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module

entry.name: >Bits Allocated
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Values: 8 (if Bits Stored = 8) 16 (if Bits Stored = 12)

entry.name: >Bits Stored
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Values: 8 12

entry.name: >High Bit
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Values: 7 (if BITS STORED = 8) 11 (if BITS STORED = 12)

entry.name: >Pixel Representation
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 0 (unsigned integer)

entry.name: >Pixel Data
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module

entry.name: Basic Color Image Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides the content of the color image pixel data to be printed. It is a specialization of the Image Pixel Module defined in C.7.6.3 of this part. It is encoded as a sequence of Attributes of the Image Pixel Module. Zero or one Item may be included in this Sequence. See PS 3.4 for further description.

entry.name: >Samples Per Pixel
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 3

entry.name: >Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: RGB

entry.name: >Planar Configuration
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 1 (frame interleave)

entry.name: >Rows
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module.

entry.name: >Columns
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module.

entry.name: >Pixel Aspect Ratio
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module.

entry.name: >Bits Allocated
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 8

entry.name: >Bits Stored
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 8

entry.name: >High Bit
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 7

entry.name: >Pixel Representation
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module. Enumerated Value: 0000H (unsigned integer)

entry.name: >Pixel Data
entry.description: See C.7.6.3 for description of Image Pixel Module

entry.name: Annotation Position
entry.description: The position of the annotation box in the parent film box. Annotation position sequence depends on the selected Annotation Display Format ID (2010,0030)

entry.name: Text String
entry.description: Text string

entry.name: Execution Status
entry.description: Execution status of print job. Enumerated Values: PENDING PRINTING DONE FAILURE

entry.name: Execution Status Info
entry.description: Additional information about Execution Status (2100,0020). Defined Terms when the Execution Status is DONE or PRINTING: NORMAL Defined Terms when the Execution Status is FAILURE: INVALID PAGE DES = The specified page layout cannot be printed or other page description errors have been detected. INSUFFIC MEMORY = There is not enough memory available to complete this job. See Section C.13.9.1 for additional Defined Terms when the Execution Status is PENDING or FAILURE.

entry.name: Creation Date
entry.description: Date of print job creation.

entry.name: Creation Time
entry.description: Time of print job creation.

entry.name: Print Priority
entry.description: Priority of print job (see C.13.1 for further explanation).

entry.name: Printer Name
entry.description: User defined name identifying the printer.

entry.name: Originator
entry.description: DICOM Application Entity Title that issued the print operation.

entry.name: Printer Status
entry.description: Printer device status. Enumerated Values: NORMAL WARNING FAILURE

entry.name: Printer Status Info
entry.description: Additional information about Printer Status (2110,0010). Defined Terms when the Printer Status is equal to NORMAL: NORMAL See Section C.13.9.1 for Defined Terms when the Printer Status is equal to WARNING or FAILURE.

entry.name: Printer Name
entry.description: User defined name identifying the printer.

entry.name: Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the printer.

entry.name: Manufacturer Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model number of the printer.

entry.name: Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the printer.

entry.name: Software Versions
entry.description: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the printer.

entry.name: Date Of Last Calibration
entry.description: Date when the printer was last calibrated.

entry.name: Time Of Last Calibration
entry.description: Time when the printer was last calibrated.

entry.name: Printer Configuration Sequence
entry.description: Contains printer configuration information for a single Application Entity title. See Print Management Service Class Structure in PS 3.4. The sequence shall contain one item for each physical printer/Meta SOP Class combination supported by the Application Entity title.

entry.name: >SOP Classes Supported
entry.description: The Meta-SOP Class and a list of optional SOP Classes supported. It shall contain one Meta SOP Class UID and 0-n optional SOP Class UIDs.

entry.name: >Maximum Memory Allocation
entry.description: Maximum number of kilobytes of memory that can be allocated for a Film Session. The value shall be 0 if Memory Allocation (2000,0060) is not supported.

entry.name: >Memory Bit Depth
entry.description: The maximum number of bits for each pixel that can be stored in printer memory.

entry.name: >Printing Bit Depth
entry.description: The number of bits used by the print engine for internal LUT calculation and printing of each pixel.

entry.name: >Media Installed Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which specifies the combinations of Medium Type and Film Size IDs available in the printer at this time and the Min and Max Densities supported by these media. The Item Number with the value of 1 is the printer default. There is no significance to other item numbers. One item for each Medium Type and Film Size ID installed shall be included.

entry.name: >>Item Number
entry.description: A number that labels this item. Each item in the sequence shall have a unique number.

entry.name: >>Medium Type
entry.description: See C.13.1

entry.name: >>Film Size ID
entry.description: See C.13.3

entry.name: >>Min Density
entry.description: Minimum density that can be printed, expressed in hundredths of OD.

entry.name: >>Max Density
entry.description: Maximum density that can be printed, expressed in hundredths of OD.

entry.name: >Other Media Available Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which specifies combinations of Medium Type and Film Size ID for which the printer will accept an N-CREATE of a Film Box, but are not physically installed in the printer at this time. It also specifies the Min and Max Densities supported by these media. User intervention may be required to instal these media in the printer. One item for each Medium Type and Film Size ID available, but not installed shall be included.

entry.name: >>Medium Type
entry.description: See C.13.1

entry.name: >>Film Size ID
entry.description: See C.13.3

entry.name: >>Min Density
entry.description: Minimum density that can be printed, expressed in hundredths of OD.

entry.name: >>Max Density
entry.description: Maximum density that can be printed, expressed in hundredths of OD.

entry.name: >Supported Image Display Formats Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which specifies the Image Display Formats supported, rows and columns in Image Boxes for each format, pixel spacing, and whether Requested Image Size is supported as a function of Film Orientation, Film Size ID, and Printer Resolution ID. One item for each display format, film orientation, film size, and printer resolution combination shall be included.

entry.name: >>Rows
entry.description: Number of printable rows in an Image Box.

entry.name: >>Columns
entry.description: Number of printable columns in an Image Box

entry.name: >>Image Display Format
entry.description: See C.13.3

entry.name: >>Film Orientation
entry.description: See C.13.3

entry.name: >>Film Size ID
entry.description: See C.13.3

entry.name: >>Printer Resolution ID
entry.description: Printer Resolution identification. Defined Terms are the same as Requested Resolution ID (2020,0050). See C.13.3.

entry.name: >>Printer Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance on the printed film between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order.

entry.name: >>Requested Image Size Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether the printer supports Requested Image Size (2020,0030) for this display format and film orientation and size combination. Enumerated Values: NO = not supported YES = supported

entry.name: >Default Printer Resolution ID
entry.description: The printer's default resolution identification. Defined Terms are the same as Requested Resolution ID (2020,0050). See C.13.3.

entry.name: >Default Magnification Type
entry.description: Printer's default magnification type. See C.13.3 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: >Other Magnification Types Available
entry.description: Other magnification types available in the printer. See C.13.3 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: >Default Smoothing Type
entry.description: Printer's default smoothing type. See C.13.3.

entry.name: >Other Smoothing Types Available
entry.description: Other smoothing types available in the printer. See C.13.3.

entry.name: >Configuration Information Description
entry.description: A free form text description of Configuration Information (2010,0150) supported by the printer.

entry.name: >Maximum Collated Films
entry.description: The maximum number of films that can be collated for an N-ACTION of the Film Session. The value shall be 0 if N-ACTION of the Film Session is not supported.

entry.name: >Decimate/Crop Result
entry.description: Indicates whether the printer will decimate or crop image pixels if the image rows or columns is greater than the available printable pixels in an Image Box. See C.13.5. Enumerated Values when the printer does not support Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior (2020,0040): DECIMATE = image will be decimated to fit. CROP = image will be cropped to fit. FAIL = N-SET of the Image Box will fail Enumerated Values when the printer supports Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior (2020,0040): DEF DECIMATE = image will be decimated to fit. DEF CROP = image will be cropped to fit DEF FAIL = N-SET of the Image Box will fail This value indicates the printer default if the SCU does not create or set Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior for the Image Box.

entry.name: Transaction UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies this Storage Commitment transaction.

entry.name: Retrieve AE Title
entry.description: Application Entity Title where the SOP Instance(s) may be retrieved via a network based retrieve service.

entry.name: Storage Media File-Set ID
entry.description: User or implementation specific human readable identification of a Storage Media on which the SOP Instances reside.

entry.name: Storage Media File-Set UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a Storage Media on which the SOP Instances reside.

entry.name: Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of repeating Items where each Item references a single SOP Instance for which storage commitment is requested / or has been provided.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Retrieve AE Title
entry.description: Application Entity Title from which the SOP Instance may be retrieved via a network based retrieve service.

entry.name: >Storage Media File-Set ID
entry.description: The user or implementation specific human readable identifier that identifies a Storage Media on which this SOP Instance resides.

entry.name: >Storage Media File-Set UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a Storage Media on which this SOP Instance resides.

entry.name: Failed SOP Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of repeating Items where each Item references a single SOP Instance for which storage commitment could not be provided.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Failure Reason
entry.description: The reason that storage commitment could not be provided for this SOP Instance. See Section C.14.1.1.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: SR = SR Document

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series. Note: No SR-specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Series. Note: No SR-specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance for which the Series is created. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Notes: 1. The Performed Procedure Step referred to by this Attribute is the Step during which this Document is generated. 2. If this Document is generated during the same Modality or General Purpose Performed Procedure Step as the evidence in the current interpretation procedure, this attribute may contain reference to that Modality or General Purpose Performed Procedure Step. 3. This Attribute is not used to convey reference to the evidence in the current interpretation procedure. See Current Requested Procedure Evidence Sequence (0040,A375). 4. This Sequence may be sent zero length if the Performed Procedure Step is unknown.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: > Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the SR Document.

entry.name: Completion Flag
entry.description: The estimated degree of completeness of this SR Document with respect to externally defined criteria in a manner specified in the Conformance Statement. Note: It may be desirable to make these criteria adaptable to local policies or user decisions. Enumerated Values: PARTIAL = Partial content. COMPLETE = Complete content.

entry.name: Completion Flag Description
entry.description: Explanation of the value sent in Completion Flag (0040,A491).

entry.name: Verification Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether this SR Document is Verified. Enumerated Values: UNVERIFIED = Not attested to. VERIFIED = Attested to by a Verifying Observer Name (0040,A075) who is accountable for its content. Note: The intent of this specification is that the "prevailing final version" of an SR Document is the version having the most recent Verification DateTime (0040,A030), Completion Flag (0040,A491) of COMPLETE and Verification Flag (0040,A493) of VERIFIED.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the document content creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the document content creation started.

entry.name: Verifying Observer Sequence
entry.description: The person or persons authorized to verify documents of this type and accept responsibility for the content of this document. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if Verification Flag (0040,A493) is VERIFIED. Note: In HL7 Structured Documents, the comparable attribute is the “legalAuthenticator”.

entry.name: >Verifying Observer Name
entry.description: The person authorized by the Verifying Organization (0040,A027) to verify documents of this type and who accepts responsibility for the content of this document.

entry.name: >Verifying Observer Identification Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded identifier of Verifying Observer. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID defined.

entry.name: >Verifying Organization
entry.description: Organization to which the Verifying Observer Name (0040,A075) is accountable in the current interpretation procedure.

entry.name: >Verification DateTime
entry.description: Date and Time of verification by the Verifying Observer Name (0040,A075).

entry.name: Author Observer Sequence
entry.description: The person or device that created the clinical content of this document. This attribute sets the default Observer Context for the root of the content tree. Zero or one Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Identified Person or Device Macro' Table C.17-3b

entry.name: Participant Sequence
entry.description: Persons or devices related to the clinical content of this document. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Participation Type
entry.description: Participant’s role with respect to the clinical content of this document. See C.17.2.5. Defined Terms: SOURCE – Equipment that contributed to the content ENT – Data enterer (e.g., transcriptionist) ATTEST – Attestor Note: In HL7 Structured Documents, the participation comparable to Attestor is the “Authenticator”.

entry.name: >Participation Datetime
entry.description: Datetime of participation with respect to the clinical content of this document.

include.ref: >Include 'Identified Person or Device Macro' Table C.17-3b

entry.name: Custodial Organization Sequence
entry.description: Custodial organization for this SR Document instance. Represents the organization from which the document originates and that is in charge of maintaining the document, i.e., the steward of the original source document. Note: This may or may not be identical to the Institution identified in the Equipment Module. Zero or one Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Institution Name
entry.description: Name of Custodial Institution or Organization.

entry.name: >Institution Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded identifier of Custodial Institution or Organization. Zero or one Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID defined.

entry.name: Predecessor Documents Sequence
entry.description: Shall refer to SR SOP Instances (e.g. prior or provisional reports) whose content has been wholly or partially included in this document with or without modification. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if this document includes content from other documents. Note: The amendment process of an existing SR Document is not explicitly described, but several approaches may be considered. One may choose, for example, to create a new SR Document that includes the original content with any amendments applied or included. The structure of this amended SR Document may or may not reflect what was amended. However, the use of the Predecessor Document Sequence allows tracing back to the input SR Document, which in this case is the previous version.

include.ref: >Include 'SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table C.17-3

entry.name: Identical Documents Sequence
entry.description: Duplicates of this document, stored with different SOP Instance UIDs. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if this document is stored with different SOP Instance UIDs in one or more other Studies. See C.17.2.2 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include 'SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table C.17-3

entry.name: Referenced Request Sequence
