entry.description: Identifies Requested Procedures which are being fulfilled (completely or partially) by creation of this Document. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if this Document fulfills at least one Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study.

entry.name: >Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instance. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Class

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Accession Number
entry.description: A departmental IS generated number which identifies the order for the Study.

entry.name: >Placer Order Number/Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party placing the order.

entry.name: >Filler Order Number/Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party filling the order.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier of the related Requested Procedure

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Description
entry.description: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the requested procedure. Zero or one Item may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID Number is specified.

entry.name: >Reason for the Requested Procedure
entry.description: Reason for requesting this procedure.

entry.name: >Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded Reason for requesting this procedure. One or more sequence items may be present.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID Number is specified.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that conveys the codes of the performed procedures pertaining to this SOP Instance. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID Number is specified.

entry.name: Current Requested Procedure Evidence Sequence
entry.description: Full set of Composite SOP Instances, of which the creator is aware, which were created to satisfy the current Requested Procedure(s) for which this SR Document is generated or that are referenced in the content tree. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if the creator is aware of Composite Objects acquired in order to satisfy the Requested Procedure(s) for which the SR Document is or if instances are referenced in the content tree. May be present otherwise. See C.17.2.3 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include 'SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table C.17-3

entry.name: Pertinent Other Evidence Sequence
entry.description: Other Composite SOP Instances that are considered to be pertinent evidence by the creator of this SR Document. This evidence must have been acquired in order to satisfy Requested Procedures other than the one(s) for which this SR Document is generated. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if pertinent evidence from other Requested Procedures needs to be recorded. See C.17.2.3 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include 'SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table C.17-3

entry.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: Sequence specifying SOP Instances significantly related to the current SOP Instance. Such referenced Instances may include equivalent documents or renderings of this document. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if the identity of a CDA Document equivalent to the current SOP Instance is known at the time of creation of this SOP Instance (see C.17.2.6). May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Code describing the purpose of the reference to the Instance(s). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is CID 7006.

entry.name: Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study

entry.name: Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items where each Item includes the Attributes of a Series containing referenced Composite Object(s). One or more Items may be included in this sequence

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of a Series that is part of this Study and contains the referenced Composite Object(s).

entry.name: >Retrieve AE Title
entry.description: Title of the DICOM Application Entity where the Composite Object(s) may be retrieved on the network.

entry.name: >Storage Media File-Set ID
entry.description: The user or implementation specific human readable identifier that identifies the Storage Media on which the Composite Object (s) reside.

entry.name: >Storage Media File-Set UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Storage Media on which the Composite Object (s) reside.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: References to Composite Object SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are part of the Study defined by Study Instance UID and the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E). One or more Items may be included in this sequence

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >>Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID may be specified in Macro invocation.

entry.name: >>Referenced Digital Signature Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of references to Digital Signatures in the referenced SOP Instance. Zero or more Items may be present. Note: The Attributes in this sequence can be used to detect if the referenced SOP Instance has been altered.

entry.name: >>>Digital Signature UID
entry.description: The Unique Identifier of a Digital Signature held in the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >>>Signature
entry.description: The Signature Value identified by the Digital Signature UID within the Referenced SOP Instance UID.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance MAC Sequence
entry.description: A MAC Calculation from data in the referenced SOP Instance that can be used as a data integrity check. Note: This Attribute may be used in place of the Referenced Digital Signature Sequence Attribute (0400,0402), particularly if the SOP Instance does not have appropriate Digital Signatures that can be referenced.

entry.name: >>>MAC Calculation Transfer Syntax UID
entry.description: The Transfer Syntax UID used to encode the values of the Data Elements included in the MAC calculation. When computing the MAC, only Transfer Syntaxes that explicitly include the VR and use Little Endian encoding shall be used. Notes: 1. Certain Transfer Syntaxes, particularly those that are used with compressed data, allow the fragmentation of the pixel data to change. If such fragmentation changes, Digital Signatures generated with such Transfer Syntaxes could become invalid. 2. This does not constrain the transfer syntax used to transmit the object.

entry.name: >>>MAC Algorithm
entry.description: The algorithm used in generating the MAC. Defined Terms: RIPEMD160 MD5 SHA1 Note: Digital Signature Security Profiles (see PS 3.15) may require the use of a restricted subset of these terms.

entry.name: >>>Data Elements Signed
entry.description: A list of Data Element Tags in the order they appear at the top level of the referenced SOP Instance that identify the Data Elements used in creating the MAC. See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.1.

entry.name: >>>MAC
entry.description: The MAC generated as described in Section 12.2.1.1, but unencrypted and without inclusion of fields from the Digital Signatures Sequence. See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.2.

table.name: IDENTIFIED PERSON OR DEVICE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Observer Type
entry.description: Enumerated Values: PSN – Person DEV – Device

entry.name: Person Name
entry.description: Name of the person observer for this document Instance. Required if Observer Type value is PSN.

entry.name: Person Identification Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded identifier of person observer. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this sequence. Required if Observer Type value is PSN.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID defined

entry.name: Station Name
entry.description: Name of the device observer for this document instance. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Device UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of device observer. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the device observer. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Manufacturer’s Model Name
entry.description: Model Name of the device observer. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Institution Name
entry.description: Institution or organization to which the identified person is responsible or accountable, or which manages the identified device.

entry.name: Institution Code Sequence
entry.description: Institution or organization to which the identified person is responsible or accountable, or which manages the identified device. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID defined
Include Document Content Macro Table C.17-5. with a Value Type (0040,A040) of CONTAINER
Include Document Relationship Macro Table C.17-6.

entry.name: Value Type
entry.description: The type of the value encoded in this Content Item. Defined Terms: TEXT NUM CODE DATETIME DATE TIME UIDREF PNAME COMPOSITE IMAGE WAVEFORM SCOORD TCOORD CONTAINER See C.17.3.2.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Concept Name Code Sequence
entry.description: Code describing the concept represented by this Content Item. Also conveys the value of Document Title and section headings in documents. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TEXT or NUM or CODE or DATETIME or DATE or TIME or UIDREF or PNAME. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is CONTAINER and a heading is present, or this is the Root Content Item. Note: That is, containers without headings do not require Concept Name Code Sequence Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is COMPOSITE, IMAGE, WAVEFORM, SCOORD or TCOORD, and the Purpose of Reference is conveyed in the Concept Name. See C.17.3.2.2 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID.

entry.name: Text Value
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TEXT. Text data which is unformatted and whose manner of display is implementation dependent. The text value may contain spaces, as well as multiple lines separated by either LF, CR, CR LF or LF CR, but otherwise no format control characters (such as horizontal or vertical tab and form feed) shall be present, even if permitted by the Value Representation of UT. The text shall be interpreted as specified by Specific Character Set (0008,0005) if present in the SOP Common Module. Note: The text may contain single or multi-byte characters and use code extension techniques as described in PS 3.5 if permitted by the values of Specific Character Set (0008,0005).

entry.name: DateTime
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is DATETIME.

entry.name: Date
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is DATE.

entry.name: Time
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TIME.

entry.name: Person Name
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is PNAME.

entry.name: UID
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is UIDREF.

include.ref: Include 'Numeric Measurement Macro' Table C.18.1-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is NUM.
Include 'Code Macro' Table C.18.2-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is CODE.
Include 'Composite Object Reference Macro' Table C.18.3-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is COMPOSITE.
Include 'Image Reference Macro' Table C.18.4-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is IMAGE.
Include 'Waveform Reference Macro' Table C.18.5-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is WAVEFORM.
Include 'Spatial Coordinates Macro' Table C.18.6-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is SCOORD.
Include 'Temporal Coordinates Macro' Table C.18.7-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is TCOORD.
Include 'Container Macro' Table C.18.8-1 if and only if Value Type (0040,A040) is CONTAINER.

entry.name: Observation DateTime
entry.description: The date and time on which this Content Item was completed. For the purpose of recording measurements or logging events, completion time is defined as the time of data acquisition of the measurement, or the time of occurrence of the event. Required if the date and time are different from the Content Date (0008,0023) and Content Time (0008,0033) or the Observation DateTime (0040,A032) defined in higher items. May be present otherwise. Note: When Content Items are copied into successor reports, the Content Date (0008,0023) and Content Time (0008,0033) of the new report are likely to be different than the date and time of the original observation. Therefore this attribute may need to be included in any copied Content Items to satisfy the condition.

entry.name: Content Sequence
entry.description: A potentially recursively nested Sequence of Items that conveys content that is the Target of Relationships with the enclosing Source Content Item. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if the enclosing Content Item has relationships. Notes: 1. If this Attribute is not present then the enclosing Item is a leaf. 2. The order of Items within this Sequence is semantically significant for presentation. See C.17.3.2.4 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Relationship Type
entry.description: The type of relationship between the (enclosing) Source Content Item and the Target Content Item. IODs specify additional constraints on Relationships (including lists of Enumerated Values). Defined Terms: CONTAINS HAS PROPERTIES HAS OBS CONTEXT HAS ACQ CONTEXT INFERRED FROM SELECTED FROM HAS CONCEPT MOD See C.17.3.2.4 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include Document Relationship Macro Table C.17-6 if the Target Content Item is included by-value in the Source Content Item. The Macro shall not be present if the relationship is by-reference.
>Include Document Content Macro Table C.17-5 if the Target Content Item is included by-value in the Source Content Item. The Macro shall not be present if the relationship is by-reference.

entry.name: >Referenced Content Item Identifier
entry.description: An ordered set of one or more integers that uniquely identifies the Target Content Item of the relationship. The root Content Item is referenced by a single value of 1. Each subsequent integer represents an ordinal position of a Content Item in the Content Sequence (0040,A730) in which it belongs. The Referenced Content Item Identifier is the set of these ordinal positions along the by-value relationship path. The number of values in this Multi-Value Attribute is exactly the number of relationships traversed in the SR content tree plus one. Note: 1. See C.17.3.2.5. 2. Content Items are ordered in a Content Sequence starting from 1 as defined in VR of SQ (See PS 3.5). Required if the Target Content Item is denoted by-reference, i.e. the Document Relationship Macro and Document Content Macro are not included.

table.name: KEY OBJECT DOCUMENT SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: KO = Key Object Selection

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series. Note: No specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Series. Note: No specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance for which the Series is created. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Notes: See notes on this attribute in Section C.17.1 SR Document Series Module

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: > Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Document.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the document content creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the document content creation started.

entry.name: Referenced Request Sequence
entry.description: Identifies Requested Procedures to which this Document pertains. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if this Document pertains to at least one Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study.

entry.name: >Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instance. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Class

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Accession Number
entry.description: A departmental IS generated number which identifies the order for the Study.

entry.name: >Placer Order Number/Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party placing the order.

entry.name: >Filler Order Number/Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party filling the order.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier of the related Requested Procedure

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Description
entry.description: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the requested procedure. Zero or one Item may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID Number is specified.

entry.name: Current Requested Procedure Evidence Sequence
entry.description: List of all Composite SOP Instances referenced in the Content Sequence (0040,A730). One or more Items shall be included in this sequence. Note: In the context of the Key Object Selection, the current evidence is considered to be only the set of instances referenced within the Key Object Selection.

include.ref: >Include 'SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table C.17-3

entry.name: Identical Documents Sequence
entry.description: Duplicates of this document, stored with different SOP Instance UIDs. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if this Key Object Selection document references instances in more than one Study. See C.17.2.2 and C.17.6.2.1 for further explanation and conditions.

include.ref: >Include 'SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table C.17-3

entry.name: Measured Value Sequence
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Shall consist of a Sequence of Items conveying the measured value(s), which represent integers or real numbers and units of measurement. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Numeric Value
entry.description: Numeric measurement value. Only a single value shall be present.

entry.name: >Measurement Units Code Sequence
entry.description: Units of measurement. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 82.

entry.name: Numeric Value Qualifier Code Sequence
entry.description: Qualification of Numeric Value in Measured Value Sequence, or reason for absence of Measured Value Sequence Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 42.

entry.name: Concept Code Sequence
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is specified.

entry.name: Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: References to Composite Object SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: Include 'Composite Object Reference Macro' Table C.18.3-1

entry.name: >Referenced Frame Number
entry.description: Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1. Note: This Attribute may be multi-valued. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

entry.name: >Referenced Segment Number
entry.description: Identifies the segments to which the reference applies identified by Segment Number (0062,0004). Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: Reference to a Softcopy Presentation State SOP Class/SOP Instance pair. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced Real World Value Mapping Instance Sequence
entry.description: Reference to a Real World Value Mapping SOP Class/SOP Instance pair. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Icon Image Sequence
entry.description: This Icon Image is representative of the Image. The Icon Image may be no greater than 128 rows by 128 columns.

include.ref: >> Include ‘Image Pixel Macro’ Table C.7-11b See Section F.7.
Include 'Composite Object Reference Macro' Table C.18.3-1

entry.name: >Referenced Waveform Channels
entry.description: List of channels in Waveform to which the reference applies. See C.18.5.1.1 Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Waveform that contains multiple Channels and not all Channels in the Waveform are referenced.

entry.name: Graphic Data
entry.description: An ordered set of (column,row) pairs that denote positions in an image specified with sub-pixel resolution such that the origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is Columns\Rows. The values must be within the range 0\0 to Columns\Rows. The values Columns (0028,0011) and Rows (0028,0010) are those contained in the referenced image. See C.18.6.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Graphic Type
entry.description: See C.18.6.1.2 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: Temporal Range Type
entry.description: See C.18.7.1.1 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: Referenced Sample Positions
entry.description: List of samples within a multiplex group specifying temporal points of the referenced data. Position of first sample is 1. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Waveform and Referenced Time Offsets (0040,A138) and Referenced Datetime (0040,A13A) are not present. May be used only if Referenced Channels (0040,A0B0) refers to channels within a single multiplex group.

entry.name: Referenced Time Offsets
entry.description: Specifies temporal points for reference by number of seconds after start of data. Required if Referenced Sample Positions (0040,A132) and Referenced Datetime (0040,A13A) are not present.

entry.name: Referenced Datetime
entry.description: Specifies temporal points for reference by absolute time. Required if Referenced Sample Positions (0040,A132) and Referenced Time Offsets (0040,A138) are not present.

entry.name: Continuity of Content
entry.description: This flag specifies for a CONTAINER whether or not its contained Content Items are logically linked in a continuous textual flow, or are separate items. Enumerated Values: SEPARATE CONTINUOUS See C.18.8.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Content Template Sequence
entry.description: Template that describes the content of this Content Item and its subsidiary Content Items. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Required if a template was used to define the content of this Item, and the template consists of a single CONTAINER with nested content, and it is the outermost invocation of a set of nested templates that start with the same CONTAINER (see C.18.8.1.2).

entry.name: >Mapping Resource
entry.description: Mapping Resource that defines the template. See Section 8.4. Defined Terms: DCMR = DICOM Content Mapping Resource

entry.name: >Template Identifier
entry.description: Template identifier.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this image. The value shall be unique within a series.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the raw data creation was started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the raw data creation was started.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data started. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the synchronization Module in Acquisition Time synchronized (0018,1800).

entry.name: Creator-Version UID
entry.description: Unique identification of the equipment and version of the software that has created the Raw Data information. The UID allows one to avoid attempting to interpret raw data with an unknown format.

entry.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides reference to a set of SOP Class/Instance pairs identifying other Instances significantly related to this Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.ref: >Include ‘Image SOP Instance Reference Macro’ Table 10-3

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. See C.7.6.16.2.5.1.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.
Include any private attributes that contain Raw Data information. See section C.19.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: REG

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the content creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the content creation started.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12

entry.name: Registration Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of one or more registration items. Each item defines a spatial registration to the referenced images in that item. All referenced images are in the same spatial frame of reference or atlas.

entry.name: >Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: Identifies a Frame of Reference that may or may not be an image set (e.g. atlas or physical space). See C.7.4.1.1.1 for further explanation. Required if Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140) is absent. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the set of images registered in this sequence item. One or more items shall be present. Required if Frame of Reference UID (0020,0052) is absent. May be present otherwise.

include.ref: >>Include 'Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: >Matrix Registration Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that specifies one spatial registration. Exactly one item shall be present

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Comment
entry.description: User description or comments about the registration.

entry.name: >>Registration Type Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the information input into the registration process. Only one item may be present.

include.ref: >>>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 7100

entry.name: >>Matrix Sequence
entry.description: One or more items shall be present. Each item specifies a transformation. The item order is significant and corresponds to matrix multiplication order. See C.20.2.1.1.

entry.name: >>>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix
entry.description: A 4x4 homogeneous transformation matrix that registers the referenced images to the local RCS. Matrix elements shall be listed in row-major order. See C.20.2.1.1.

entry.name: >>>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix Type
entry.description: Type of Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix (3006,00C6). Defined terms: RIGID RIGID_SCALE AFFINE See C.20.2.1.2

entry.name: >Used Fiducials Sequence
entry.description: The fiducials used to determine the Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix. One or more Items may be present.

include.ref: >>Include ‘SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-8 Reference to the Spatial Fiducial SOP Instance identifying the Used Fiducial(s)

entry.name: >>Fiducial UID
entry.description: The UID that identifies the fiducial used as registration input.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the vector grid data creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the vector grid data creation started.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12

entry.name: Deformable Registration Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of one or more registration items. Each item defines a spatial registration to the referenced images in that item. At least one item shall have a Deformable Registration Grid Sequence (0064,0005) with one item. See C.20.3.1.1.

entry.name: >Source Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: Identifies the Frame of Reference of a Source RCS. The Source RCS may or may not include an image set (e.g. atlas). See C.7.4.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the set of images registered in this sequence item. One or more items shall be present. Required if the registration applies to a subset of images within the specified Source Frame of Reference UID (0064,0003). All referenced images shall be in the same spatial frame of reference.

include.ref: >>Include 'Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: >Frame of Reference Transformation Comment
entry.description: User description or comments about the registration.

entry.name: >Registration Type Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the method used for the registration process. Zero or one item shall be present.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 7100

entry.name: >Pre Deformation Matrix Registration Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that specifies one spatial registration to be applied prior to the deformation. Exactly one item shall be present. Required if a matrix transformation is to be applied prior to deformation.

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix
entry.description: A 4x4 homogeneous transformation matrix. Matrix elements shall be listed in row-major order. See C.20.2.1.1.

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix Type
entry.description: Type of Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix (3006,00C6). Defined terms: RIGID RIGID_SCALE AFFINE See C.20.2.1.2

entry.name: >Post Deformation Matrix Registration Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that specifies one spatial registration to be applied after the application of the deformation. Exactly one item shall be present. Required if matrix transformation is to be performed after application of the deformation.

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix
entry.description: A 4x4 homogeneous transformation matrix. Matrix elements shall be listed in row-major order. See C.20.2.1.1.

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix Type
entry.description: Type of Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix (3006,00C6). Defined terms: RIGID RIGID_SCALE AFFINE See C.20.2.1.2

entry.name: >Deformable Registration Grid Sequence
entry.description: Describes the deformation grid used to sample into the Source RCS. Exactly one item shall be present. Required if deformation is performed. See C.20.3.1.2.

entry.name: >>Image Orientation (Patient)
entry.description: The direction of cosines of the first row and first column of the Vector Grid Data (0064,0009) with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Image Position (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates of the upper left hand voxel (center of the first voxel transmitted) of the grid, in mm in the Registered Frame of Reference. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Grid Dimensions
entry.description: The dimensions of the grid, in voxels. A triple representing the number of voxels along the X, Y, and Z axes.

entry.name: >>Grid Resolution
entry.description: The resolution of the grid voxels. A triple representing the size of a deformation voxel in along the X, Y, and Z dimension, in mm.

entry.name: >>Vector Grid Data
entry.description: A data stream of vectors. See C.20.3.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Used Fiducials Sequence
entry.description: The fiducials used to determine the registration. One or more Items may be present.

include.ref: >> Include 'Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3 Reference to the Spatial Fiducial SOP Instance identifying the Used Fiducial(s)

entry.name: >>Fiducial UID
entry.description: The UID that identifies the fiducial used as registration input.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: FID

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the content creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the content creation started.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12

entry.name: Fiducial Set Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of one or more items, each of which is a fiducial set.

entry.name: >Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: Identifies a Frame of Reference that may or may not be an image set (e.g. an atlas or physical space). See C.7.4.1.1.1 for further explanation. Required if Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140) is absent. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the set of images in which the fiducials are located. Required if Frame of Reference UID (0020,0052) is absent. May be present otherwise. One or more Items shall be present. All referenced images shall have the same Frame of Reference UID if present in the images.

include.ref: >>Include 'Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: >Fiducial Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that specifies one or more fiducials, one item per fiducial.

entry.name: >>Fiducial Identifier
entry.description: A fiducial assignment identifier that is unique within this Fiducial Sequence item but may match the fiducial identifier of an equivalent feature in another item.

entry.name: >>Fiducial Identifier Code Sequence
entry.description: A code sequence for a term that identifies a well-known fiducial type (potentially including methodology, anatomy, tools, etc.). Only one item shall be present. Required if Identifier (0070,0310) is absent. May be present otherwise.

include.ref: >>>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 DCID 7101

entry.name: >>Fiducial UID
entry.description: Globally unique identifier for the fiducial instance of this fiducial assignment.

entry.name: >>Fiducial Description
entry.description: User description or comments about the fiducial.

entry.name: >>Shape Type
entry.description: See C.21.2.1.1 for defined terms.

entry.name: >>Number of Contour Points
entry.description: Number of points (triplets) in Contour Data (3006,0050). Required if Contour Data is present.

entry.name: >>Contour Data
entry.description: Specifies the coordinates of this item's fiducial. One triplet (x,y,z) shall be present for each point in the fiducial. See C.21.2.1.2 for further explanation. Required if Frame of Reference UID (0020,0052) is present in this item of the Fiducial Set Sequence (0070,031C). Shall not be present otherwise. Note: Contour Data may not be properly encoded if Explicit-VR transfer syntax is used and the VL of this attribute exceeds 65534 bytes.

entry.name: >>Contour Uncertainty Radius
entry.description: The estimated uncertainty radius for the Contour Data in mm. See C.21.2.1.3

entry.name: >>Graphic Coordinates Data Sequence
entry.description: The image pixel locations of the fiducial’s points. Shall contain one or more items. More than one item shall be present only if a fiducial spans more than one image. Required if Contour Data is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>>Graphic Data
entry.description: Graphic point coordinates of the fiducial points in the image of the Referenced Image Sequence. If Fiducial’s Contour Data (3006,0050) is present, these points correlate to the points in the Contour Data, one row-column pair for each point and in the same order. See C.10.5.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that specifies the image containing the fiducial’s graphic coordinates. Only one item shall be present. Shall be an image within the set of the images in the Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140) of the encapsulating Fiducial Set Sequence (0070,031C) item.

include.ref: >>>>Include 'Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: Storage Media File-Set ID
entry.description: User or implementation specific human readable identification of the Storage Media to be created.

entry.name: Storage Media File-Set UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a Storage Media to be created.

entry.name: Number of Copies
entry.description: Number of copies of set of media to be created for storing this file-set. Note: If the entire request fits on a single piece of media per copy, then this value corresponds to the actual number of pieces of media to be created.

entry.name: Request Priority
entry.description: Specifies the priority of the request. Enumerated Values: HIGH MED LOW

entry.name: Label Using Information Extracted From Instances
entry.description: Specifies whether or not to extract label information from the instances. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Label Text
entry.description: Unformatted free text to include in the label instead of or in addition to information extracted from the instances.

entry.name: Label Style Selection
entry.description: An implementation-dependent code string that may be used as a hint to select a particular layout or format of label.

entry.name: Media Disposition
entry.description: Unstructured text that describes where and to whom the media is to be sent.

entry.name: Barcode Value
entry.description: String that describes the bar code value to be printed on the media label. Note It is SCU responsibility to convey a value for this attribute coherent in length and content with the requested Barcode Symbology (2200,0006).

entry.name: Barcode Symbology
entry.description: Code string that describes the bar code symbology that shall be used for printing the Barcode Value (2200,0005). See Section C.22.1.1 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Allow Media Splitting
entry.description: A flag indicating if the SCP is allowed to split this request over more than one piece of media. Enumerated Values: YES NO Note: 1. The SCP is not required to support the split of a media creation request across more than one piece of media. 2. If the size of the set of SOP instances is greater than the media storage capacity, and this flag has been set to NO, the SCP shall refuse to process the request.

entry.name: Allow Lossy Compression
entry.description: A flag indicating if the SCP is allowed to perform lossy compression. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Include Non-DICOM Objects
entry.description: A flag indicating if the SCP should include in the media additional Non-DICOM information/objects Defined Terms: NO FOR_PHYSICIAN FOR_PATIENT FOR_TEACHING FOR_RESEARCH

entry.name: Include Display Application
entry.description: A flag indicating if the SCP should include on the media a DICOM Instance Display Application. Enumerated Values: NO YES

entry.name: Preserve Composite Instances After Media Creation
entry.description: A flag to indicate whether or not the SCU intends to issue a subsequent media creation request referencing some or all of the instances contained in Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199). Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of repeating Items where each Item references a single SOP Instance, the Media Application Profile to be used, and, where applicable, the icon representing the referenced image

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Requested Media Application Profile
entry.description: The Media Application Profile to be used for this SOP Instance. Note: This is the label of the profile as defined in PS 3.11, e.g. “STD-XABC-CD”.

entry.name: >Icon Image Sequence
entry.description: This Icon Image is representative of the Image.

include.ref: >> Include ‘Image Pixel Macro’ Table C.7-11.2

entry.name: Execution Status
entry.description: Execution status of a request. See Section C.22.1.2 for Enumerated Values

entry.name: Execution Status Info
entry.description: Additional information about Execution Status (2100,0020). When Execution Status is DONE, CREATING or IDLE, Defined Terms are: NORMAL See Section C.22.1.3 for Defined Terms when the Execution Status is PENDING or FAILURE.

entry.name: Total Number of Pieces of Media Created
entry.description: Number of pieces of media that have been successfully created, in order to store all copies of the requested file-set. Note: If the entire request fits on a single piece of media per copy, then this value corresponds to the number of copies of media created.

entry.name: Failed SOP Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of repeating Items describing SOP Instances for which media creation failed.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Requested Media Application Profile
entry.description: The Media Application Profile used for this SOP Instance. Note: This is the label of the profile as defined in PS 3.11, e.g. “STD-XABC-CD”.

entry.name: >Failure Reason
entry.description: The reason that media creation failed for this SOP Instance. See Section C.22.1.4.

entry.name: >Failure Attributes
entry.description: Attributes associated with the Failure Reason (0008,1197). See Section C.22.1.4.

entry.name: Referenced Storage Media Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence describing the identifiers of all pieces of media created to satisfy the request. One or more items are allowed. Note: If the SCP splits a media creation request across more than one piece of media (e.g. if it doesn’t fit on one), then all the created pieces of media will be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: > Storage Media File-Set ID
entry.description: User or implementation specific human readable identification of the Storage Media that has been created.

entry.name: > Storage Media File-Set UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Storage Media that has been created.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol Name
entry.description: Short descriptor that identifies the Hanging Protocol.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol Description
entry.description: Explanation of the objective or intent of the Hanging Protocol.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol Level
entry.description: Identifies the level at which this Hanging Protocol is defined, and the intended use. Enumerated values: MANUFACTURER SITE USER_GROUP SINGLE_USER

entry.name: Hanging Protocol Creator
entry.description: Identifies the creator of the Hanging Protocol.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol Creation Datetime
entry.description: Date and time on which the Hanging Protocol was created.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol Definition Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that defines the type of imaging studies to which this Hanging Protocol applies. One or more sequence items shall be present. See C.23.1.1.1.

entry.name: >Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create images or related objects to which this Hanging Protocol applies. See C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms. Required if Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Anatomic Region Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest to which this Hanging Protocol applies. One or more sequence items may be present. Required if Modality (0008,0060) is not present. May be present otherwise.

include.ref: >>Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID 4

entry.name: >Laterality
entry.description: Laterality of the body part to which this Hanging Protocol applies. Enumerated Values: R – Right L – Left B – Both U – Unpaired Zero length means not applicable. Required if Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) is present.

entry.name: > Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies a procedure to which this Hanging Protocol applies. One or more sequence items may be present.

include.ref: >>Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined

entry.name: >Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies a reason for procedure to which this Hanging Protocol applies. One or more sequence items may be present.

include.ref: >>Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined

entry.name: Number of Priors Referenced
entry.description: Identifies the number of prior image sets used in this Hanging Protocol.

entry.name: Image Sets Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing one or more types of Image Sets to which the Hanging Protocol applies. One or more sequence items shall be present. See C.23.1.1.2.

entry.name: >Image Set Selector Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing Image Set selection attributes and values that are used to identify one type of image or object set for the Hanging Protocol. One or more sequence items shall be present. See C.23.1.1.3.

entry.name: >>Image Set Selector Usage Flag
entry.description: Indicates the behavior of matching against an image object when the Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is not available in the image object. Enumerated Values: MATCH – if the attribute is not in the image object, consider the image to be a match anyway. NO_MATCH – if the attribute is not in the image object, then do not consider the image to be a match.

entry.name: >>Selector Attribute
entry.description: Data Element Tag of an Attribute from an Image or other IOD to use for Image Set selection.

entry.name: >>Selector Attribute VR
entry.description: The Value Representation of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026). See PS 3.5 for Enumerated Values of Value Representation.

include.ref: >>Include Hanging Protocol Selector Attribute Context Macro Table C.23.4-1
>>Include Hanging Protocol Selector Attribute Value Macro Table C.23.4-2

entry.name: >>Selector Value Number
entry.description: Positive integer identifying which value of a multi-valued attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is to be used for Image Set selection. The value 1 identifies the first value. The value zero identifies any value.

entry.name: >Time Based Image Sets Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing time based Image Set selection categories and values that are used to identify one type of image set for the Hanging Protocol per sequence item. One or more sequence items shall be present. The Image Set Selector Sequence (0072,0022) shall be applied to each sequence item to define an image set. See C.23.1.1.2.

entry.name: >>Image Set Number
entry.description: A monotonically increasing integer, starting from 1, incrementing by one, unique within the Hanging Protocol Instance. Note: Each item of the Display Sets Sequence (0072,0200) references one Image Set Number (0072,0032).

entry.name: >>Image Set Selector Category
entry.description: Category of the Time Based Image Set selector. Enumerated Values: RELATIVE_TIME ABSTRACT_PRIOR

entry.name: >>Relative Time
entry.description: Exactly two numeric values, indicating the start and end values of a prior range of instance acquisition times relative to the date and time of a current image set. The units shall be specified in Relative Time Units (0072,003A). The value pair 0\0 shall indicate a current image set. The value pair n\n shall indicate “prior from the instance acquisition time of a current image set by n units”. Required if the value of Image Set Selector Category (0072,0034) is RELATIVE_TIME. Note: 1. A value pair “1\7” with Relative Time Units (0072,003A) of DAYS would indicate the range “prior by 1 to 7 days before a current image set”. 2. The VR of this attribute is unsigned, hence future time cannot be represented.

entry.name: >>Relative Time Units
entry.description: Units of time for Relative Time (0072,0038). Enumerated Values: SECONDS, MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS, WEEKS, MONTHS, YEARS. Required if Relative Time (0072,0038) is present.

entry.name: >>Abstract Prior Value
entry.description: Identifies a prior image set in abstract terms. Exactly two integer values, indicating the range of prior studies to include. Each value shall be greater than zero, where 1 indicates the most recent prior and higher values indicate successively older priors. The special value –1 shall indicate the oldest prior. Notes: 1. The value pair n\n indicates the nth prior. 2. The value pair -1\-1 indicates the oldest prior. 3. The value pair m\n indicates the mth through nth priors, where m is the more recent prior. 4. The value pair 1\-1 indicates all priors. 5. The value pair m\-1 indicates the mth prior and all priors older than m. Required if Image Set Selector Category (0072,0034) is ABSTRACT_PRIOR and Abstract Prior Code Sequence (0072,003E) is not present.

entry.name: >>Abstract Prior Code Sequence
entry.description: Identifies a prior image set using coded terminology. Only one sequence item shall be present. Required if Image Set Selector Category (0072,0034) is ABSTRACT_PRIOR and Abstract Prior Value (0072,003C) is not present.

include.ref: >>>Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID 31

entry.name: >>Image Set Label
entry.description: Description of the objective of the image set defined by this sequence item.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol User Identification Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that provides a coded identifier for the person, group, or site for which this Hanging Protocol was defined. Only one sequence item may be present. Note: If a standardized naming schema becomes available, it should be used. Meanwhile, local coding schemes such as employee numbers and department numbers are likely to be used.

include.ref: >Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 No baseline context ID is defined.

entry.name: Hanging Protocol User Group Name
entry.description: Group or site for which this Hanging Protocol was defined.

entry.name: Source Hanging Protocol Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the Hanging Protocol from which this Hanging Protocol was derived, or on which it is based. One sequence item may be present.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Class UID.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Instance UID.

entry.name: Number of Screens
entry.description: Positive integer indicating the number of screens for which this Hanging Protocol is intended.

entry.name: Nominal Screen Definition Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of zero or more items that describes the set of screens for which this Hanging Protocol is intended.

entry.name: >Number of Vertical Pixels
entry.description: Positive integer indicating the intended number of rows of the addressable area of the screen in pixels. Note: The goal is not absolute size matching.

entry.name: >Number of Horizontal Pixels
entry.description: Positive integer indicating the intended number of columns of the addressable area of the screen in pixels. Note: The goal is not absolute size matching.

entry.name: >Display Environment Spatial Position
entry.description: Exactly four unitless floating point values indicating the rectangular coordinate position of the screen within the overall bounding box that encompasses all the screens. See C.23.2.1.1.

entry.name: >Screen Minimum Grayscale Bit Depth
entry.description: Positive integer indicating the desired minimum number of grayscale bits per pixel of the screen. Required if Screen Minimum Color Bit Depth (0072,010C) is not present.

entry.name: >Screen Minimum Color Bit Depth
entry.description: Positive integer indicating the desired minimum total number of bits per color channel used to present a pixel. Required if Screen Minimum Grayscale Bit Depth (0072,010A) is not present. Note: A 24-bit color system with 8 bits per color channel (red, green, blue) would have a value of 8.

entry.name: >Application Maximum Repaint Time
entry.description: Positive integer indicating the desired maximum time in milliseconds required by the application to repaint the full screen once (i.e., recalculate all pixels and paint them to the screen). Note: This is not the screen refresh time.

entry.name: Display Sets Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes one or more display sets used to present the Image Sets defined in the Image Sets Sequence (0072,0020). One or more sequence items shall be present. See C.23.3.1.

entry.name: >Display Set Number
entry.description: A monotonically increasing integer, starting from 1, incrementing by one, unique within the Hanging Protocol Instance. It shall be used to identify linked display sets in the Display Set Scrolling Group (0072,0212).

entry.name: >Display Set Label
entry.description: Description of the objective of the display set defined by this sequence item.

entry.name: >Display Set Presentation Group
entry.description: Positive integer value that designates this Display Set as part of a specific presentation group. All Display Sets with the same Display Set Presentation Group (0072,0204) value shall be displayed at the same time. The value 1 shall indicate that this Display Set is part of the initial presentation group.Subsequent values incrementing by 1 shall imply successive temporal ordering of display.

entry.name: >Image Set Number
entry.description: Image Set Number (0072,0032) value from a Time Based Image Sets Sequence (0072,0030) Item within the Image Sets Sequence (0072,0020) Item that is selected for display by this Display Set. Note: Multiple Image Boxes Sequence (0072,0300) Items within a Display Sets Sequence (0072,0200) Item may be used to spread one image set over multiple image boxes with the same Display Set characteristics.

entry.name: >Image Boxes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that defines the image boxes for this Display Set. Exactly one sequence item shall be present unless Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is TILED, in which case one or more items shall be present.

entry.name: >>Image Box Number
entry.description: A monotonically increasing integer that identifies the order of image boxes for scrolling, starting from 1, incrementing by one, unique within a Display Set Sequence Item.

entry.name: >>Display Environment Spatial Position
entry.description: Exactly four unitless floating point values indicating the rectangular coordinate position of the image box within the overall bounding box that encompasses all the display space (across all screens). See C.23.2.1.1.

entry.name: >>Image Box Layout Type
entry.description: Type of layout of the image box. All types except for TILED are single rectangles containing a single frame of image pixel data. The types are primarily distinguished by their interaction technique. Defined Terms: TILED: a scrollable array of rectangles, each containing a single frame of image pixel data. STACK: a single rectangle containing a steppable single frame, intended for user-controlled stepping through the image set, usually via continuous device interaction (e.g., mouse scrolling) or by single stepping (mouse or button click). CINE: a single rectangle, intended for video type play back where the user controls are play sequence, rate of play, and direction. PROCESSED: intended for interactive 3D visualizations that have custom interfaces. SINGLE: a single rectangle, intended for images and objects with no defined methods of interaction. Note: This value may also be used for non-image objects, such as waveforms and SR documents.

entry.name: >>Image Box Tile Horizontal Dimension
entry.description: Positive integer defining the horizontal Image Box tile dimension; the number of columns. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is TILED.

entry.name: >>Image Box Tile Vertical Dimension
entry.description: Positive integer defining the vertical Image Box tile dimension; the number of rows. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is TILED.

entry.name: >>Image Box Scroll Direction
entry.description: Enumerated Values: VERTICAL: scroll images by row HORIZONTAL: scroll images by column. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is TILED, and the value of Image Box Tile Horizontal Dimension (0072,0306) or Image Box Tile Vertical Dimension (0072,0308) is greater than 1.

entry.name: >>Image Box Small Scroll Type
entry.description: Defines the type of small increment scrolling to be applied to this Image Box. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is TILED, and the value of Image Box Tile Horizontal Dimension (0072,0306) or Image Box Tile Vertical Dimension (0072,0308) is greater than 1. Scrolling is not specified if zero length. Enumerated Values: PAGE: In a TILED image box, replace all image slots with the next N x M images in the set, ROW_COLUMN: in a TILED image box, move each row or column of images to the next row or column, depending on Image Box Scroll Direction (0072,0310) IMAGE: In a TILED image box, move each image to the next slot, either horizontally or vertically, depending on Image Box Scroll Direction (0072,0310) Note: If there are multiple image boxes of different Tile Dimensions in a Display Set, then only IMAGE scrolling applies, and the value of this attribute is ignored.

entry.name: >>Image Box Small Scroll Amount
entry.description: Defines the positive integer number of pages, rows, columns, or images per small increment scroll, based on the values of Image Box Small Scroll Type (0072,0312) and Image Box Scroll Direction (0072,0310). The value applies to both forward and backward scrolling. Required if Image Box Small Scroll Type (0072,0312) is present with a value.

entry.name: >>Image Box Large Scroll Type
entry.description: Defines the type of large increment scrolling to be applied to this Image Box. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is TILED, and the value of Image Box Tile Horizontal Dimension (0072,0306) or Image Box Tile Vertical Dimension (0072,0308) is greater than 1. Enumerated Values: PAGE: In a TILED image box, replace all image slots with the next N x M images in the set, ROW_COLUMN: in a TILED image box, move each row or column of images to the next row or column, depending on Image Box Scroll Direction (0072,0310) IMAGE: In a TILED image box, move each image to the next slot, either horizontally or vertically, depending on Image Box Scroll Direction (0072,0310) Note: If there are multiple image boxes of different Tile Dimensions in a Display Set, then only IMAGE scrolling applies, and the value of the attribute is ignored.

entry.name: >>Image Box Large Scroll Amount
entry.description: Defines the positive integer number of pages, rows, columns, or images per large increment scroll, based on the values of Image Box Large Scroll Type (0072,0316) and Image Box Scroll Direction (0072,cc50). The value applies to both forward and backward scrolling. Required if Image Box Large Scroll Type (0072,0316) is present with a value.

entry.name: >>Image Box Overlap Priority
entry.description: If this Image Box overlaps in spatial position with others, this attribute indicates the layer of this Image Box in relation to the others. The value shall be a positive integer in the range 1 to 100, where 1 = top and 100 = bottom. If this attribute is not present, then the expected behavior is not defined.

entry.name: >>Preferred Playback Sequencing
entry.description: Describes the preferred playback sequencing for the Image Box. Overrides any Preferred Playback Sequencing (0018,1244) value in the image objects being displayed. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is CINE. Enumerated Values: 0 = Looping (1,2...n,1,2,...n,1,2,....n,...) 1 = Sweeping (1,2,...n,n-1,...2,1,2,...n,...) 2 = Stop (1,2…n)

entry.name: >>Recommended Display Frame Rate
entry.description: Recommended rate at which the frames of a multi-frame image shall be displayed, in frames/second. Shall have a value greater than zero. Overrides any Recommended Display Frame Rate (0008,2144) value in the image objects being displayed. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is CINE and if Cine Relative to Real-Time (0072,0330) is not present.

entry.name: >>Cine Relative to Real-Time
entry.description: A positive unitless floating point numeric factor equal to playback rate divided by acquisition rate. Required if the value of Image Box Layout Type (0072,0304) is CINE and if Recommended Display Frame Rate (0008,2144) is not present. Note: The capture rate may change within the image object, as specified in Frame Time (0018,1063) or Frame Time Vector (0018,1065).

entry.name: >Filter Operations Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that defines filter criteria to be applied to the image set identified by Image Set Number (0072,0032). Zero or more items shall be included in this sequence. See C.23.3.1.1.

entry.name: >>Filter-by Category
entry.description: Category of the filter operation. See C.23.3.1.1. Defined terms: IMAGE_PLANE Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is not present.

entry.name: >>Filter-by Attribute Presence
entry.description: Operation to be applied based on the presence or absence of the attribute represented by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) in each image of the Image Set. Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is present and Filter-by Operator (0072,0406) is not present. Enumerated Values: PRESENT: Include the image if the attribute is present NOT_PRESENT: Include the image if the attribute is not present

entry.name: >>Selector Attribute
entry.description: Data Element Tag of an Attribute from an Image IOD to use as a filter. See C.23.3.1.1 for potential attributes. Required if Filter-by Category (0072,0402) is not present.

entry.name: >>Selector Attribute VR
entry.description: The Value Representation of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) or Filter-by Category (0072,0402), and Filter-by Operator (0072,0406) are present.

include.ref: >>Include Hanging Protocol Selector Attribute Context Macro Table C.23.4-1
>>Include Hanging Protocol Selector Attribute Value Macro Table C.23.4-2

entry.name: >>Selector Value Number
entry.description: Positive integer identifying which value of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is to be used for filtering. The value 1 identifies the first value. The value zero identifies any value. Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) and Filter-by Operator (0072,0406) are present.

entry.name: >>Filter-by Operator
entry.description: Operation to be applied between the value(s) in the Hanging Protocol Selector Attribute Value Macro (“selector”), and the value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) in each image of the Image Set. See C.23.3.1.1. Required if Filter-by Category (0072,0402) is present, or if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is present and Filter-by Attribute Presence (0072,0404) is not present. Enumerated Values: RANGE_INCL: the values lie within the specified range, or are equal to the endpoints; applies only to numeric, date or time Selector Attribute (0072,0026); two values shall be present in the selector, the first of which is less than or equal to the second RANGE_EXCL: the values lie outside the specified range, and are not equal to the endpoints; applies only to numeric Selector Attribute (0072,0026); two values shall be present in the selector, the first of which is less than or equal to the second GREATER_OR_EQUAL: applies only to numeric Selector Attribute (0072,0026) LESS_OR_EQUAL: applies only to numeric Selector Attribute (0072,0026) GREATER_THAN: applies only to numeric Selector Attribute (0072,0026) LESS_THAN: applies only to numeric Selector Attribute (0072,0026) MEMBER_OF: one of the values in the image is present in the values of the selector; if one value is present in each, this is an “equal to” operator NOT_MEMBER_OF: none of the values in the image is present in the values of the selector; if one value is present in each, this is a “not equal to” operator

entry.name: >Sorting Operations Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that defines sorting criteria to be applied to the result of filter and reformat operations, to define the order in which to present the images in the Image Boxes. Zero or more items shall be included in this sequence. See C.23.3.1.2.

entry.name: >>Selector Attribute
entry.description: Data Element Tag of an Attribute from an Image IOD to be used for sorting. See C.23.3.1.2 for potential attributes. Required if Sort-by Category (0072,0602) is not present.

include.ref: >>Include Hanging Protocol Selector Attribute Context Macro Table C.23.4-1

entry.name: >>Selector Value Number
entry.description: Positive integer identifying which value of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is to be used for sorting. The value of 1 identifies the first value. Shall not be zero. Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is present.

entry.name: >>Sort-by Category
entry.description: Category of the sorting operation. See C.23.3.1.2. Defined terms: ALONG_AXIS: for CT, MR, other cross-sectional image sets BY_ACQ_TIME Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is not present.

entry.name: >>Sorting Direction
entry.description: Sorting direction to be applied to the value(s) in the image set of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) or Sort-by Category (0072,0602). Enumerated Values: INCREASING, DECREASING

entry.name: >Blending Operation Type
entry.description: Type of blending of superimposed and underlying images from the image set, performed before reformatting. See C.23.3.1.3. Defined Terms: COLOR – apply a pseudo-color to the superimposed image while blending

entry.name: >Reformatting Operation Type
entry.description: Reformatting operation to be applied to the Image Set. Defined terms: MPR, 3D_RENDERING, SLAB

entry.name: >Reformatting Thickness
entry.description: The desired thickness of the reformatted images in millimeters. Required if value of Reformatting Operation Type (0072,0510) is SLAB or MPR. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Reformatting Interval
entry.description: The desired spacing of the reformatted images in millimeters. The spacing is measured from the center-to-center of each reconstructed image. Required if value of Reformatting Operation Type (0072,0510) is SLAB or MPR. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Reformatting Operation Initial View Direction
entry.description: Initial view of the reformatted images. Required if the value of Reformatting Operation Type (0072,0510) is MPR or 3D_RENDERING. May be present otherwise. Defined Terms: SAGITTAL, AXIAL, CORONAL, OBLIQUE

entry.name: >3D Rendering Type
entry.description: Describes the intended 3D rendering type. One or more values shall be present. The first value shall not be zero length. Required if the value of Reformatting Operation Type (0072,0510) is 3D_RENDERING: Defined Terms for value 1: MIP, SURFACE, VOLUME Additional values may be used to identify implementation specific sub-types.

entry.name: >Display Set Patient Orientation
entry.description: Patient direction of the rows and columns of the images, as intended for display. See C.23.3.1.4.

entry.name: >Display Set Horizontal Justification
entry.description: Indicates direction in which to horizontally justify the image within a viewport that is not the same shape (aspect ratio) as the image. Enumerated Values: LEFT CENTER RIGHT Note: Typically used in mammography display applications in which images from the patient’s left and right are displayed “back to back”, rather than centered.

entry.name: >Display Set Vertical Justification
entry.description: Indicates direction in which to vertically justify the image within a viewport that is not the same shape (aspect ratio) as the image. Enumerated Values: TOP CENTER BOTTOM

entry.name: >VOI Type
entry.description: Expected value of interest transformation for display (e.g., Window Center and Window Width or VOI LUT). Defined Terms: LUNG MEDIASTINUM ABDO_PELVIS LIVER SOFT_TISSUE BONE BRAIN POST_FOSSA

entry.name: >Pseudo-color Type
entry.description: A category of pseudo-color palette choice to be applied after application of the VOI LUT. If this attribute is not present, a pseudo-color palette shall not be applied. Defined Terms: BLACK_BODY HOT_IRON DEFAULT

entry.name: >Show Grayscale Inverted
entry.description: Whether or not to invert the rendered luminance of the displayed values. See C.23.3.1.4. Enumerated values: YES = The maximum output value after the display pipeline has been applied shall be displayed with the minimum available luminance. NO = The maximum output value after the display pipeline has been applied shall be displayed with the maximum available luminance. Notes: 1. The YES and NO values of this Attribute correspond to the Presentation LUT Shape (2050,0020) values of INVERSE and IDENTITY, as described in C.11.6.1.2. 2. Only applicable to display of grayscale images.

entry.name: >Show Image True Size Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether or not to display images with the physical size of the rendered image pixel the same on the screen as specified in the image attributes, unless overridden by a Presentation State instance. Enumerated values: YES = Display images at True Size. NO = The rendered size is not specified.

entry.name: >Show Graphic Annotation Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether or not to display items from the Graphic Annotation Sequence (0070,0001) in an applied Presentation State, and the attributes of the Overlay Plane module in the image objects or applied Presentation State. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: >Show Patient Demographics Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether or not to display patient and study identification information. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: >Show Acquisition Techniques Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether or not to display image acquisition technique information. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: >Display Set Presentation Group Description
entry.description: Description of the intent of the Display Set Presentation Group (0072,0204). If present, shall have the same value in all sequence Items assigned the same value for Display Set Presentation Group (0072,0204).

entry.name: Partial Data Display Handling
entry.description: If one or more Image Sets identified by Image Set Number (0072,0032) in the Display Sets Sequence (0072,0200) Items is not available, indicate whether or not to maintain the expected layout in the absence of complete Image Sets. Enumerated Values: MAINTAIN_LAYOUT: If one or more Image Sets is not available, maintain the layout with empty Image Boxes. ADAPT_LAYOUT: If one or more Image Sets is not available, rearrange the layout at the discretion of the application. If this attribute is zero length, then the expected behavior is not defined.

entry.name: Synchronized Scrolling Sequence
entry.description: Each sequence item of this attribute identifies a group of Display Sets to which synchronized scrolling is to be applied. Zero or more sequence items may be present. The dimensions along which the synchronization occurs shall be those specified in the Sorting Operations Sequence (0072,0600).

entry.name: >Display Set Scrolling Group
entry.description: Multi-valued list of two or more Display Set Number (0072,0202) values. Indicates that the images within the specified Display Sets are scrolled in parallel, to maintain the established synchronization.

entry.name: Navigation Indicator Sequence
entry.description: Describes a geometric relationship between Display Sets for the purpose of static or interactive localization or navigation. One or more sequence items may be present.

entry.name: >Navigation Display Set
entry.description: Display Set Number (0072,0202) of the Display Set where the geometric relationship to the Reference Display Sets (0072,0218) is graphically depicted. Required if there is a one-way interaction such that the location of the Reference Display Sets is indicated on or controlled by the Navigation Display Set. Note: For example, the graphical representation may indicate either the number of slices displayed or contained in the Reference Display Set(s).

entry.name: >Reference Display Sets
entry.description: One or more Display Set Number (0072,0202) values. If Navigation Display Set is present, shall list those Display Sets that are controlled by or indicated on the Navigation Display Set. If Navigation Display Set is absent, shall indicate that all of the Reference Display Sets cross-reference each other.

table.name: HANGING PROTOCOL SELECTOR ATTRIBUTE CONTEXT MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Selector Sequence Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the Sequence that contains the Attribute that is identified by the Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if the Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is nested in a Sequence. Shall not be used to identify code sequence attributes. See Selector Code Sequence Value (0072,0080).

entry.name: Functional Group Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the Functional Group Sequence that contains the Attribute that is identified by the Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if the value of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is the Data Element Tag of an Attribute that is contained within a Functional Group Sequence.

entry.name: Selector Sequence Pointer Private Creator
entry.description: Identification of the creator of a group of private data elements. Required if the Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

entry.name: Functional Group Private Creator
entry.description: Identification of the creator of a group of private data elements. Required if the Functional Group Pointer (0020,9167) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

entry.name: Selector Attribute Private Creator
entry.description: Identification of the creator of a group of private data elements. Required if the Selector Attribute (0072,0026) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

table.name: HANGING PROTOCOL SELECTOR ATTRIBUTE VALUE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Selector AT Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is AT.

entry.name: Selector CS Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is CS.

entry.name: Selector IS Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is IS. Some leniency in precision and format (including padding with spaces and leading zeros, e.g., “001” = “ 1 “ = “1”) will be required.

entry.name: Selector LO Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is LO.

entry.name: Selector LT Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is LT.

entry.name: Selector PN Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is PN.

entry.name: Selector SH Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is SH.

entry.name: Selector ST Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is ST.

entry.name: Selector UT Value
