entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is UT.

entry.name: Selector DS Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is DS. Some leniency in precision and format (including padding and scientific notation) will be required.

entry.name: Selector FD Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is FD.

entry.name: Selector FL Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is FL.

entry.name: Selector UL Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is UL.

entry.name: Selector US Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is US.

entry.name: Selector SL Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is SL.

entry.name: Selector SS Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is SS.

entry.name: Selector Code Sequence Value
entry.description: The value(s) of the attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026). One or more sequence items shall be present. See C.23.4.2.1.2. Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is present and the value is SQ, and Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is a code sequence.

include.ref: >Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 No baseline context ID is defined.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: The modality appropriate for the encapsulated document. This Type definition shall override the definition in the SC Equipment Module. See section C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Series.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance for which the Series is created. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Note: The Performed Procedure Step referred to by this Attribute is the Step during which this Document is generated.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: > Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Series Description
entry.description: User provided description of the Series

entry.name: Request Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that contains attributes from the Imaging Service Request. The sequence may have one or more Items.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Requested Procedure in the Imaging Service Request. Required if Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Reason for the Requested Procedure
entry.description: Reason for requesting this procedure.

entry.name: >Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded Reason for requesting this procedure. One or more sequence items may be present.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Scheduled Procedure Step. Required if Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Scheduled Procedure Step to be performed.

entry.name: >Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Scheduled Protocol following a specific coding scheme. This sequence contains one or more Items.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >>Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>>Include ‘Content Item Macro’ Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >>> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.

include.ref: >>>>Include ‘Content Item Macro’ Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated identifier of that part of a Procedure that has been carried out within this step.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Date
entry.description: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Time
entry.description: Time on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Procedure Step that was performed.

entry.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for this Procedure Step. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.ref: >Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include ‘Content Item Macro’ Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.

include.ref: >>>Include ‘Content Item Macro’ Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: Comments on the Performed Procedure Step
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Performed Procedure Step.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this SOP Instance. The value shall be unique within a series.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the document content creation was started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the document content creation was started.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the original generation of the data in the document started.

entry.name: Burned In Annotation
entry.description: Indicates whether or not the encapsulated document contains sufficient burned in annotation to identify the patient and date the data was acquired. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Source Instance Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that identifies the set of Instances that were used to derive the encapsulated document. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence. Required if derived from one or more DICOM Instances. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: > Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Document Title
entry.description: The title of the document. Note: In the case of a PDF encapsulated document, this may be the value of the “Title” entry in the “Document Information Directory” as encoded in the PDF data.

entry.name: Concept Name Code Sequence
entry.description: A coded representation of the document title. Zero or one item may be present.

include.ref: >Include ‘Code Sequence Macro’ Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context Group 7020

entry.name: Verification Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether the Encapsulated Document is Verified. Enumerated Values: UNVERIFIED = Not attested by a legally accountable person. VERIFIED = Attested to (signed) by a Verifying Observer or Legal Authenticator named in the document, who is accountable for its content.

entry.name: MIME Type of Encapsulated Document
entry.description: The type of the encapsulated document stream described using the MIME Media Type (see RFC 2046).

entry.name: Encapsulated Document
entry.description: Encapsulated Document stream, containing a document encoded according to the MIME Type.

table.name: REAL WORLD VALUE MAPPING SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: RWV

table.name: REAL WORLD VALUE MAPPING MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the content creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the content creation started.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12

entry.name: Referenced Image Real World Value Mapping Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of one or more real world value mapping items. Each item defines a single mapping and a list of images to which the mapping applies.

include.ref: >Include Real World Value Mapping Macro Table C.7.6.16-12, overriding the Defined Context ID for Measurement Units Code Sequence with DCID 83.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: A sequence listing the images to which the mapping applies. One or more items shall be present.

include.ref: >>Include 'Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: File-set ID
entry.description: User or implementation specific Identifier (up to 16 characters). For definition, see PS 3.10. The File-set ID is intended to be a short human readable label to easily (but not necessarily uniquely) identify a specific File-set to facilitate operator manipulation of the physical media on which the File-set is stored. Assignment of Value and semantics are environment specific.

entry.name: File-set Descriptor File ID
entry.description: ID of a File (in the same File-set) used for user comments related to the File-set (e.g. a readme file). The Specific Character set used may be specified in the Specific Character Set of the File-set Descriptor File (0004,1142). Note: This File is not DICOM formatted (no Preamble, nor DICM Prefix and Meta Information).

entry.name: Specific Character Set of File-set Descriptor File
entry.description: Character set used in the File-set Descriptor File with a File ID as specified in File-set Descriptor File ID (0004,1141). Required to specify the expanded or replacement character set. If absent, only the Basic Graphic set is used. See C.12.1.1.2 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Offset of the First Directory Record of the Root Directory Entity
entry.description: Offset of the first byte (of the Item Data Element) of the first Directory Record of the Root Directory Entity. This Offset is a number of bytes starting with the first byte of the File Meta Information. When the Root Directory Entity contains no Directory Record, this offset shall be set to 00000000H. Note: This offset includes the File Preamble and the DICM Prefix.

entry.name: Offset of the Last Directory Record of the Root Directory Entity
entry.description: Offset of the first byte (of the Item Data Element) of the last Directory Record of the Root Directory Entity. This Offset is a number of bytes starting with the first byte of the File Meta Information. When the Root Directory Entity contains no Directory Record, this offset shall be set to 00000000H. Note: This offset includes the File Preamble and the DICM Prefix.

entry.name: File-set Consistency Flag
entry.description: When set, this Flag indicates that an inconsistency within the Directory or between the Directory and the Files of the File-set may exist. Potential recovery actions are implementation specific and are beyond the scope of this Standard. Enumerated Values: 0000H: no known inconsistencies FFFFH: the FSR or FSU shall assume that inconsistencies are present. This flag shall be set by implementations before a File-set update which, if interrupted, may result in an inconsistent File-set. Note: There may be error conditions where an inconsistency is present but this flag is not set. There may also be conditions where no inconsistencies are present but the flag is set.

entry.name: Directory Record Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of zero or more repeating Items where each Item contains a Directory Record by including the Directory Elements from (0004,1400) to (0004,1511) and Record selection Keys as defined below (marked with a >). A zero length Value indicates that no Directory Records are contained in the Root Directory Entity.

entry.name: >Offset of the Next Directory Record
entry.description: Offset of the first byte (of the Item Data Element) of the next Directory Record of the same Directory Entity. This Offset is an unsigned integer representing a number of bytes starting with the first byte of the File Meta-information. A zero offset shall be used to mean that there is no other Directory Record in this Directory Entity. Required if the Directory Record Sequence (0004,1220) is not zero length. This Offset may be used to keep an inactive Record (0004,1410) chained with the next Directory Record of the same Directory Entity. Note: This offset includes the File Preamble and the DICM Prefix.

entry.name: >Record In-use Flag
entry.description: This flag facilitates the deletion of referenced files. Enumerated Values: FFFFH = record is in use. 0000H = record is inactive. All attributes of an inactive Directory Record except (0004,1400) and (0004,1410) shall be ignored. Other Values are reserved and shall not be set by File-set Creators, but if present shall be interpreted as FFFFH by File-set Readers or Updaters. Required if the Directory Record Sequence (0004,1220) is not zero length. If a Directory Record is changed from in use to inactive, the FSU shall ensure that all Directory Records of referenced lower-level Directory Entities are changed to inactive.

entry.name: >Offset of Referenced Lower-Level Directory Entity
entry.description: Offset of the first byte (of the Item Data Element) of the first Directory Record of the Referenced Lower Level Directory Entity. This Offset is a number of bytes starting with the first byte of the File Meta Information. Required if the Directory Record Sequence (0004,1220) is not zero length. When no lower-level Directory Entity (containing at least one Directory Record) is referenced, this Attribute shall have a Value of 00000000H. Note: This offset includes the File Preamble and the DICM Prefix.

entry.name: >Directory Record Type
entry.description: Defines a specialized type of Directory Record by reference to its position in the Media Storage Directory Information Model (see Section F.4). Required if the Directory Record Sequence (0004,1220) is not zero length. Enumerated Values (see Section F.5): PATIENT STUDY SERIES IMAGE RT DOSE RT STRUCTURE SET RT PLAN RT TREAT RECORD PRESENTATION WAVEFORM SR DOCUMENT KEY OBJECT DOC SPECTROSCOPY RAW DATA REGISTRATION FIDUCIAL HANGING PROTOCOL ENCAP DOC HL7 STRUC DOC VALUE MAP STEREOMETRIC PRIVATE = Privately defined record hierarchy position. Type shall be defined by Private Record UID (0004,1432). Notes: 1. Enumerated Values PRINT QUEUE, FILM SESSION, FILM BOX, and IMAGE BOX were previously defined in DICOM for this Attribute. They are now retired. See PS3.3-1998. 2. Enumerated Values OVERLAY, MODALITY LUT, VOI LUT, CURVE, TOPIC, VISIT, RESULTS, INTERPRETATION, STUDY COMPONENT and STORED PRINT were previously defined in DICOM for this Attribute. They are now retired. See PS3.3-2004. 3. Enumerated Value MRDR was previously defined in DICOM for this Attribute, to allow indirect reference to a File by multiple Directory Records. It is now retired. FSUs and FSRs are unlikely to be capable of supporting this mechanism. See PS3.3-2004.

entry.name: >Private Record UID
entry.description: Required if the Directory Record Type (0004,1430) is of Value PRIVATE. This UID is used to define a non-standard type of Directory Record by reference to its position in a private extension to the Basic Directory IOD Information Model (see Section F.5). This UID shall be registered according to the procedures defined in PS 3.5. Its meaning may or may not be specified in a Conformance Statement.

entry.name: >Referenced File ID
entry.description: A Multiple Value (See PS 3.5) which represents the ordered components of the File ID containing a "referenced object" or Referenced SOP Instance. A maximum of 8 components, each from 1 to 8 characters shall be used (see Section 8.2). Note: The Referenced File ID provides the means to "locate" the File through the DICOM File Service provided by the Media Format Layer. All referenced Files shall be with the File-set to which the Directory belongs. Any File within the File-set (to which the Directory belongs) shall be referenced by at most one Directory Record. When the Directory Record does not reference any SOP Instance this attribute shall not be present.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID in File
entry.description: Unique ID for the SOP Class of the Instance stored in the referenced File. Required if the Directory Record references a SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID in File
entry.description: Unique Identifier for the SOP Instance stored in the referenced file. Required if the Directory Record references a SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced Transfer Syntax UID in File
entry.description: Unique Identifier for the Transfer Syntax used to encode the Instance stored in the referenced file. Required if the Directory Record references a SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced Related General SOP Class UID in File
entry.description: Unique ID for the Related General SOP Class(es) related to the SOP Class of the Instance stored in the referenced file. Required if the Directory Record references a SOP Instance that encodes the Related General SOP Class UID (0008,001A). Note: This may be useful to an FSR that does not support the SOP Class of the referenced Instance, but which does support one of the Related General SOP Classes.

entry.name: Presentation Creation Date
entry.description: Date on which this presentation was created. Note: This date may be different from the date that the DICOM SOP Instance was created, since the presentation state information contained may have been recorded earlier.

entry.name: Presentation Creation Time
entry.description: Time at which this presentation was created. Note: This time may be different from the time that the DICOM SOP Instance was created, since the presentation state information contained may have been recorded earlier.

entry.name: Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items where each Item includes the Attributes of one or more Series.

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of a Series that is part of this Study. Required if sequence item is present.

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items where each Item provides reference to a selected set of Image SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are part of this Study and the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E). Required if a sequence item is present.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if sequence item is present. Shall be the same for all Images referenced by this presentation state.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if sequence item is present.

entry.name: Verification DateTime

entry.name: Concept Name Code Sequence
entry.description: Code describing the concept represented by the root Content Item (Document Title). This sequence shall contain exactly one Item.

entry.name: Content Sequence
entry.description: Contains the Target Content Items that modify the Concept Name Code Sequence of the root Content Item (Document Title). Required if the root Content Item is the Source Content Item of HAS CONCEPT MOD relationships.
